Despite the planning of the Projects to be completed by 2025-06-30, the total cost estimate of the Project has to be increased by Rs. 1,180 million due to the reasons such as price increase in construction materials and the revision of Value Added Tax (VAT). Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing to revise the total cost estimate of the Project and allocate necessary additional provisions through the Budget Estimates in year the 2025, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Purchase of spare parts, goods and materials required for the Sri Lanka Transport Board for the year 2025
decision_details: - Procurements for goods and services for the Sri Lanka Transport Board such as purchase of spare parts and accessories, new tyre kits, selection of institutions for the supply of reconditioned tyres for regional depots, procurement of grease and lubricants and for the procurement of new engine kits have to be carried out for the year 2025. Since four (04) of those procurements exceed the authority limit of the Ministry Procurement Committee, the said procurements have to be referred to the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to execute the said procurements separately through the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee and to appoint four (04) separate Technical Evaluation Committees for the said four (4) procuments to assist the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importation of High Bread Bulls to enhance the Local Milk Production
decision_details: - Although Rs. 100 million has been allocated for both the years 2023 and 2024 for the acquisition of cattle with high genetic potential, it has not been possible yet to procure the required cattle due to problems that have arisen in following the relevant procurement process. Therefore, information has been sought from several countries regarding the possibility of purchasing suitable cattle as a direct                 Government-to-Government arrangement and the Trade Development Authority of Pakistan, with the mediation of the High Commission of Pakistan, has agreed to supply 07 semen donor stud bulls of Sahiwal and Nili-Ravi breeds to the country. Similarly, it has been decided that it is appropriate to purchase 20,000 doses of Sahiwal bull semen from the National Dairy Development Board of India as a Government-to-Government arrangement until the stud bulls are imported and the bull semen is produced. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation to purchase five (05) Sahiwal stud bulls and two (02) Nili-Ravi stud bulls as a transaction between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Pakistan and to purchase 20,000 doses of Sahiwal bull semen from the National Dairy Development Board of India as a Government-to-Government arrangement, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Financial Grant provided by the Government of India to fulfill the vehicle requirement of the Sri Lanka Police
decision_details: - The Government of India has agreed to provide a financial Grant of 300 million  Sri Lankan Rupees as an assistance to fulfill the vehicle requirement of the Sri Lanka Police. It has been planned to provide Cabs by utilizing the said grant for duty requirements of Police Stations in the Northern Province. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the two parties to obtain the said Grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Government of India (GoI) and the Government of Sri Lanka (GoSL) on Cooperation in the field of sharing successful Digital Solutions for Digital Transformation
decision_details: - There is potential to gain expertise knowledge acquired by India as the global leader in information technology and digital innovation, in areas such as            e-governance, fintech, artificial intelligence and digital infrastructure for Digital Transformation in Sri Lanka through multiple engagements. Accordingly, initial consensus has been reached to sign a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry of Digital Economy of Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Electronic and Information Technology of India. This will facilitate the strengthening of the much needed capacity building of officials in digital transformation and promote institutional cooperation between both countries in the implementation of digital transformational solutions. Accordingly, the proposal made by the                Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Digital Economy to sign the proposed Memorandum of Understanding, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Review on State-Owned Non-commercial Entities
decision_details: - The Government has been entrusted with the main functions of providing essential public services and national security, maintaining law and order, various regulatory functions,  intervening in instances of market failures to duly provide good and services,  reasonable distribution of resources, disaster management and social welfare etc. The Security Forces and the Police aside, there are 86 Departments, 25 District Secretariats and 339 Divisional Secretariats, 340 State Owned Enterprises and 115 Non-commercial Public Statutory Institutions that perform the said duties at present. Approximately Rs. 140 billion has been allocated through the National Budget in the year 2024 for 115 Non-commercial Public Statutory Institutions coming under the supervision of the Department of National Budget and for 51 institutions falling under the supervision of the Department of Public Enterprises. Due to factors such as the failure of those institutions to adjust to suit the present requirements, inadequacy or misfit of the authority assigned, the functions assigned to such institutions being performed more efficiently by the private sector, and the existence of several institutions performing the same or similar functions, it has become a timely requirement to conduct a review on Non‑commercial State-owned Entities. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to appoint an Officials' Committee chaired by the Secretary to the Prime Minister to carry out such a review and submit a Report with recommendations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Procurement Guidelines on Goods, Works and Non-Consulting Services - 2024
decision_details: - The National Procurement Commission, established in terms of Article 156B.(1) of the Constitution, is responsible for formulating fair, equitable, transparent, competitive and cost-effective procedures and guidelines for the procurement of goods and services, works, consultancy services and information systems through all Government institutions, in accordance with the powers vested with the said Commission, in terms of  Article 156C.(1) of the Constitution. Accordingly, the Procurement Guidelines on the Procurement of Goods, Works and Non-Consulting Services by the Government Institutions and for matters connected and incidental  thereto - 2024, has been published in the Gazette Extraordinary Notification      No.2412/01 dated 2024-11-25. The proposal made by the Hon. President to submit the said Guidelines to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting 55,000 MT of Muriate of Potash Fertilizer to the Government of Sri Lanka as a donation under the World Food Programme
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2024-05-06 to obtain 55,000MT of Muriate of Potash Fertilizer to the Government of Sri Lanka as a donation under the World Food Programme. The Tripartite Agreement related thereto has been signed on 2024-09-20 by the World Food Organization, the Uralchem - Uralkali Group and State Fertilizer Company Limited on behalf of the Government of Sri Lanka. The vessel carrying the said stock of fertilizer is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka on 2024-12-10 and the official ceremony of handing over the stock of fertilizer to the Government of Sri Lanka has been planned to be held in the Colombo Port on 2024-12-12. The Cabinet decided to distribute the said total stock of fertilizer for farmers at the rate of 50% to be utilized for Paddy and other Crops and the remaining 50% for Coconut cultivation, taking into consideration the aforesaid information furnished by the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands and Irrigation.

title: The draft protocol between Sri Lanka and India for the avoidance of double taxation and prevention of fiscal evasion with respect to taxes on income
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of India have entered into an Agreement in the year 2013 for the avoidance of double taxation and prevention of fiscal evasion with respect to taxes on income. Since Sri Lanka and India are members of the Inclusive Framework of the Base Erosion and Profit Shifting (BEPS) Project, they are committed to implementing the minimum standards of the Group of 20 Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development. Accordingly, the need to revise the Agreement signed in 2013 for the avoidance of double taxation and prevention of fiscal evasion with respect to taxes on income, has been identified. The concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism and the clearance of the Attorney General have been received for the revised protocol which has been prepared with the necessary amendments. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to sign the revised protocol and to submit the signed protocol, in terms of section 75(1) of the Inland Revenue Act, No.24 of 2017, to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the Suspension Period of Parate Execution by the Banks
decision_details: - The economic crisis faced by Sri Lanka during the past four (04) years has severely affected the Small and Medium Scale Enterprises (SME) Sector and it has been reported that the Small and Medium Scale Entrepreneurs have encountered difficulties in settling the loans taken from Banks.  Since an environment had been created under this situation, where the properties of a significant number of businessmen have been taken over by Banks and auctioned due to the default of loans, the sale of properties by public auction has been suspended temporarily up to 2024-12-15 through an amendment to the Recovery of Loans by Banks (Special Provisions), Act No.4 of 1990. Requests have been made by Associations related to the SME Sector for further extension of the suspension of the Parate Execution Law.  The Government has observed that it would be more suitable to create the necessary environment whereby a reasonable solution to both parties could be achieved through the introduction of an Action Plan for the repayment of such loans, instead of permitting the auctioning of properties.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to extend the suspension of the implementation of the Parate Law up to 2025-03-31 and for the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, with the active participation of State and Private Banks and all other parties including State Institutions, to formulate a multi-dimensional mechanism to resolve this issue, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining support from the OPEC Fund for International Development for the Economic Stabilization and Recovery Programme
decision_details: - The Government of Sri Lanka has made a request to the OPEC Fund for International Development in order to secure funds to finance Sri Lanka's comprehensive reform agenda, in line with the Extended Fund Facility Programme supported by the International Monetary Fund. The said entity has agreed to grant a loan of US$ 50 million under the Policy Based Loan. The International Monetary Fund has also confirmed that the said loan complies with the parameters of the programme which is being implemented in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to enter into a loan agreement with the OPEC Fund for International Development to obtain the said loan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introducing an appropriate methodology to utilize the Government Bungalows, Visumpaya and President’s Houses located in various areas, under the purview of the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government
decision_details: - There are 50 government bungalows under the administrative authority of the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government, in Colombo 07 and 05. These bungalows have been allocated for former Presidents, Ministers, Deputy Ministers and various government institutions. Similarly, President’s Houses are located in Colombo, Kandy, Nuwara Eliya, Mahiyanganaya, Anuradhapura, Kataragama, Jaffna, Embilipitiya and Benthota, under the administrative authority of the Presidential Secretariat. However, President’s Houses, except for those in Colombo and Kandy, have not been used frequently. In addition, Visumpaya, located in Colombo 02, which has been used as the Official Residence of many Heads of State, is currently under the administrative authority of the Urban Development Authority. Similarly, there is an Official Residence of the Prime Minister in Nuwara Eliya under the administrative authority of the Prime Minister's Office. A large sum of money has been spent on the maintenance of the said government properties, irrespective of the fact that the said properties have been underutilized. Therefore, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government to appoint an Officials' Committee to propose an appropriate methodology, enabling to utilize the said premises and residences more productively to gain economic benefits, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of Officers to the Higher Management in the Departments of the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development
decision_details: - The Cabinet granted its approval for the following appointments and attachments as per the proposals submitted by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning & Economic Development.*	to appoint Mr. M.K. Pradeep Kumara, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, serving as the Additional Director General of the Comptroller General's Office, to the presently vacant Post of Director General of the Department of Trade and Investment Policy.*	 to appoint Mr. P.M.K. Hettiarachchi, Grade I Officer of the Sri Lanka Planning Service, serving as a Director of the Department of Development Finance, to act full time in the presently vacant Post of Director General of the Department of Development Finance.* 	to attach Ms. S.H.D. Kaluthanthree, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving as the Director General of the Department of Management Services, to the Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government, enabling to appoint her to another suitable Post and appoint Mr. Wimal S.K. Liyanagama, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving in a Post of Additional Director General of the Department of Trade and Investment Policy, to the Post of Director General of the Department of Management Services which falls vacant accordingly.*	 to attach Mr. U.D.N. Jayaweera, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Inland Revenue Service, presently acting in the Post of Commissioner General of Excise, back to the Department of Inland Revenue and appoint Mr. U.L. Udaya Kumara Perera, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Inland Revenue Service, serving as a Senior Commissioner of the Department of Inland Revenue, to the Post of Commissioner General of Excise.

title: Proceeds of Crime Bill
decision_details: - Cabinet approval has been granted on 2024-08-12 to publish the Proceeds of Crime Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman in the Government Gazette and present it in Parliament. However, after publishing the said Bill in the Government Gazette, several observations have been submitted by the International Monetary Fund.  Accordingly, the observations submitted by the International Monetary Fund have been referred to the Committee appointed by the then Minster of Justice, Prison Reforms and Constitutional Reforms under the Chairmanship of a Judge of the Supreme Court to prepare the initial draft relating to this Bill and the said Committee has recommended to amend the already prepared Proceeds of Crime Bill by incorporating certain further provisions. The proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration to instruct the Legal Draftsman to further amend the Proceeds of Crime Bill, based on the recommendations of the said Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revision of the Total Cost Estimate of the Pugoda Court Complex Construction Project and Payment for the Price Escalations
decision_details: - The approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2023-11-13 to make the relevant payments based on the recommendations of the Standing Procurement Committee of the then Ministry of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms after the said Committee had reviewed the actual price escalations calculated using the price variation formulas of the Construction Industry Development Authority (CIDA) for the constructions under the Pugoda Court Complex Construction Project. The Report regarding the price escalations submitted by the Sri Lanka State Engineering Corporation, the institution to which the consultancy services and constructions have been entrusted, has been reviewed by the Standing Procurement Committee of the said Ministry. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice and National Integration, to revise the total cost estimate of the Pugoda Court Complex Construction Project as Rs.681.2 million and pay the relevant price escalations and to allocate the provisions required for completion of the balance works of the project through budget estimates, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Issuance of a New Digital Driving License
decision_details: - Approximately 15 years have lapsed by now since the commencement of issuing a driving license as a smart card and the Government has recognized the appropriateness of issuing a digital driving license, which is currently used in many countries in the world in keeping with the new technology, facilitating the exchange of data between related institutions. Accordingly, the Cabinet decided to take necessary action to introduce a new digital driving license expeditiously in place of the driving license being used at present and to continue to implement the methodology currently being adopted for the issuance of driving licenses, taking into consideration the proposals made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation.

title: Obtaining 22 ALCO diesel engines for the Department of Sri Lanka Railways as a Grant from the Government of India
decision_details: - The Indian Railways has expressed its willingness to provide 20 slightly used and upgraded M10 locomotives and 02 additional locomotives to obtain spare parts required for the maintenance of the said 20 locomotives, as a Grant for the Department of Sri Lanka Railways. RITES, an engineering consultation and infrastructure development company in India, has submitted an unsolicited proposal to provide maintenance services for the said locomotives for a period of 05 years. The approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-06-11 to appoint a Cabinet Appointed Negotiating Committee and a Project Committee to evaluate the said proposal and submit recommendations. The Project Committee has indicated that the Department of Sri Lanka Railways has the capacity to maintain the relevant locomotives provided as a Grant and that it is appropriate to have the above work attended to by the staff of the said Department. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to sign the relevant Grant Agreement, in the first instance and accept the Grant of 22 locomotives by the Government of Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Augmentation of the Common Wastewater Treatment Plant at the Horana Export Procession Zone
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held 2023-06-05 for the augmentation of the Common Wastewater Treatment Plant at the Horana Export Procession Zone utilizing funds of the Board of Investment of Sri Lanka. Bids have been called for the purpose following the National Competitive Bidding Procedure and 11 Bids have been submitted.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to award the contract for the augmentation of the Common Wastewater Treatment Plant at the Horana Export Procession Zone to Luminex PLC, on the recommendation of the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Resolution to be submitted to the Conference of Parties of the International Convention on Wetlands (Ramsar) by Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The 15th Conference of the Parties of the International Convention on Wetlands or the Ramsar Convention will be held in Zimbabwe in July 2025. Sri Lanka has drafted a Resolution on 'Rights of Nature in Wetlands' to be submitted to the said Conference. By the said Resolution, it is expected that the member countries would recognize the rights of nature in wetlands of their countries. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Environment to submit the said Resolution to the 15th Conference of the Ramsar Convention by Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Programme for the Revival of Fishery Industry by mitigating the impact caused to it due to the economic crisis
decision_details: - With a view to reviving the fishery industry by mitigating the impact caused due to the economic crisis, the Cabinet at its meeting held on 2024-08-21 has granted approval to provide a 'fishery industry recovery allowance' of Rs.25/- per diesel liter for vessel owners who use diesel as fuel and Rs.25/- per kerosene liter for fishermen who use kerosene as fuel at the rate of 15 liter per day up to maximum 25 days per month, for a period of 06 months with effect from 2024-10-01. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources to grant a 'fishery industry recovery allowance' of Rs.9375/- monthly to the respective owners of active and small fishing vessels using kerosene as fuel, who have registered in the Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources, for a period of 05 months from 2024-11-01 with a view to simplifying the method of granting the fuel concession and to continue to provide the concession being granted to diesel vessel owners without change, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Renovation of the Karainagar Boat Yard of Cey-Nor Foundation Limited
decision_details: - The Government of India has agreed to provide a financial grant to complete the renovation work of the Karainagar Boat Yard of Cey-Nor Foundation Limited and to procure the required machinery and office equipment and approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2024-10-21 to sign a Memorandum of Understanding for the same. The said Memorandum of Understanding has not been signed as yet and it was decided to grant policy approval of the Cabinet to sign the said Agreement between the two parties and to utilize the proposed financial grant for the rehabilitation work of the Karainagar Boat Yard, taking into consideration the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources.

title: Securing Funds from the Asian Development Bank for the Power System Strengthening and Renewable Energy Integration Project
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-09-02 to negotiate with the Asian Development Bank to implement the projects identified for strengthening and modernization of electricity transmission network under the Power System Strengthening Reliability Project funded by the Asian Development Bank. Accordingly, the Asian Development Bank has agreed to provide a loan amounting to US$ 200 million which comprises of US$ 150 million and US$ 50 million, to the Ceylon Electricity Board and Lanka Electricity Company (Private) Limited respectively, under 02 separate loan agreements, on a Treasury Guarantee. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to sign a Guarantee Agreement with the Asian Development Bank in order to obtain the said Loan amount, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the Food Policy and Security Committee
decision_details: - Ensuring the national food and nutrition security and providing the food safely is a key function of the Government and providing the minimum food requirement of every citizen qualitatively and quantitatively at an affordable price is a main objective of the Government. The new Government policy statement has proposed a number of measures for this purpose and the key functions among them have been identified, including the production of all food that can be produced in the country locally, maintenance of buffer stocks of essential food sufficient for at least for 03 months, maintenance of a database on the food stocks available in the country and preparing and implementation of an effective programme with the participation of the private sector as well in the implementation processes of production, storage, distribution, wholesale and retail trade which ensures the food security. It has been decided to coordinate the National Food and Nutrition Security and Safety Programme through the Presidential Secretariat to pay more attention to these tasks and to make efficient the institutional coordination. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to establish the "Food Policy and Security Committee" under the Presidential Secretariat, under the co-chairmanship of the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation and the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development, and with the membership of the Secretary to the Prime Minister and other Secretaries to the relevant Ministries, to provide policy guidance through data and information-based scientific analysis with the participation of all institutions involved in ensuring the food security and nutrition, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting permission to import rice without obtaining Import Control Licenses
decision_details: - The Cabinet considered the suitability of temporarily removing the restrictions currently existing for the importation of rice, taking into consideration the scarcity of Nadu rice and other varieties of rice in the local market and the loss that has  occurred to the paddy cultivation due to the heavy rain persisted in the last few days. Accordingly, it was decided to grant permission with immediate effect to import rice to the country without obtaining import control licenses  until 2024-12-20.

title: Provision of an allowance for School- Age Children to purchase stationery
decision_details:
- A survey conducted by the Department of Census and Statistics has revealed that the adverse effects of the economic crisis have caused a significant negative impact on the education of 55% of school children. This percentage is higher in rural and estate areas, and it has been revealed that 53.2% of the affected children have either reduced or completely stopped purchasing school stationery, where as 26.1% have resorted to reusing previously used school stationery. Therefore, with the aim of minimizing the adverse impact on the education of school children, the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to provide an allowance for school children to purchase school stationery before the commencement of academic activities in the year 2025, as follows, was approved by the Cabinet.

	* Provision of an allowance of Rs.6000/- per child for the children of Aswesuma Beneficiary families to purchase stationery through the Welfare Benefits Board.

	* Provision of an allowance of Rs.6000/- through the Ministry of Education, 	Higher Education and Vocational 	Education for each child who fall into the categories of parentless children not included in the Aswesuma programme, children from families where mother or father is disabled, all 	school age children in orphanages and children who have left 	destitute, due to special circumstances.

title: Vote on Account - 2025
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet Meeting held on 2024 11 25 to present a Vote on Account for the period of first 04 months of the year 2025, in Parliament and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Resolution for the purpose. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Resolution relating to the Vote on Account drafted by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to move the said Resolution in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of amendments to the Aswesuma Welfare Benefits Scheme
decision_details:
- The Aswesuma Welfare Benefits Scheme has been implemented from 2023 07 01 and has been re-amended by the Extraordinary Gazette Notification No. 2384/30 and implemented from 2024 07 01. Under this Scheme, the Aswesuma welfare beneficiary families are entitled to benefits under 04 categories. As the impact of the economic crisis has not fully subsided, it has been found necessary to provide short-term relief to the families selected in the first round in relation to the transitional and vulnerable categories and the families selected in relation to the applications of second round where the selection process has been commenced. Further, concerns have been raised to the effect that the amount granted at present is not adequate, considering the current cost of living. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to amend the Aswesuma Welfare Benefits Scheme currently in force as follows, was approved by the Cabinet.
* To increase the monthly benefit allowance currently granted to poor and extremely poor categories from Rs.8,500/- to Rs.10,000/- and from Rs.15,000/- to Rs.17,500/- respectively and implement the Aswesuma Welfare Benefits Scheme revised accordingly from the date on which the said Scheme is approved by Parliament.
* To extend the benefit payment period for transitional social category until 2025 03 31.
* To extend the benefit payment period for vulnerable social category until 2025 12 31

title: Implementation of the 'Clean Sri Lanka' Programme
decision_details: - Considering the fact that Sri Lanka is currently experiencing a significant setback not only economically but also politically, socially, spiritually and environmentally, a programme named "Clean Sri Lanka" has been planned to be implemented as a national mission to achieve the national aspiration by ensuring the well-being, reconciliation and progress of the people of this country. This transformative initiative, guided by the new Government's vision of "A Thriving Nation, a Beautiful Life", will be implemented with the aim of achieving social, environmental and ethical awakening. The proposal made by the Hon. President to implement this programme through the Presidential Secretariat, establish a Presidential Task Force for this purpose, and establish a fund called the "Clean Sri Lanka Fund" under the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, which will be managed by a Board of Governors, to provide the necessary funds for the implementation of the programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Disposal of super luxury vehicles that incur a heavy burden on the Public 	Institutions following a proper procedure
decision_details: - Taking into consideration the high cost of maintenance and fuel in the use of certain luxury vehicles used in Government institutions, it has been found that disposal of such luxury vehicles is more economically effective. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to carry out a formal study on the existing vehicles in all Government institutions, to dispose the vehicles with petrol engine capacity above 1800cc and diesel engine capacity above 2300cc (except Double Cabs/ Single Cabs/ Vans/Buses) that fall under HS Heading No. 87.03, by the relevant Chief Accounting Officer before 2025 03 01, following the proper procurement procedure and to authorize the Secretary to the Treasury to issue the relevant Circular instructions in order to report the Comptroller General of the General Treasury by pursuing action accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Making provisions for recalling nominations and for calling fresh nominations for the Local Authorities Election which was due to be held in the year 2023
decision_details: - At the Cabinet meeting held on 20240902, it was decided to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Local Authorities Elections (Special Provisions) Bill to make provisions for recalling nominations and for calling fresh nominations for the Local Authorities Election which was due to be held in the year 2023.  At the meeting of Party Leaders in Parliament chaired by the Speaker of Parliament on 20241125, with the participation of the leaders of recognized political parties as well, a consensus has been reached to cancel the nominations called in 2023 and conduct the ensuing Local Authorities Election by calling fresh nominations.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare the Local Authorities Elections (Special Provisions) Bill, empowering the Election Commission to make provisions to recall the nominations already called for the Local Authorities Election and to call for fresh nominations, enabling to safeguard the right of all voters and the voting right of the youth community, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Identification and resolving of existing issues regarding Development Officers, Officers of Allied Service Categories, and Officers already in various Posts in the Public Service with a degree although the degree is not considered as a basic qualification for entry into the Public Service, and graduates expecting to join the Public Service
decision_details:
- More than 150,000 graduates including the Development Officers recruited to the Government service through various schemes  in 07 occasions from the year 1994 to 2020, are employed under the Central Government and Provincial Councils  Recruitment to the public service has been made without a proper evaluation of the skills and professional qualifications of the officers serving as  Development Officers and Officers  of Allied Service Categories. It has not been possible to achieve the expected performance of those officers, as they were not provided   with proper induction and in-service training, neither have they been formally assigned with duties and responsibilities related to the post. Similarly, more than 15,800 Development Officers are engaged in teaching in National and Provincial schools and a problematic situation has also arisen regarding recruiting them to the Teachers' Service. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister to appoint a Ministerial Committee under the Chairmanship of the Prime Minister and consisting of the following Ministers/Deputy Ministers to identify the various issues that have arisen regarding the administration as well as the performance of the Development Officers, analyze those issues and present sustainable solutions, and also to appoint an Officials' Committee chaired by the Secretary to the Prime Minister to assist the Ministerial Committee - 
Ministerial Committee:
	* Hon. Prime Minister - (Chairperson)
	* Hon. Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local 	Government
	* Hon. Deputy Minister of Economic Development
	* Hon. Deputy Minister of Education and Higher Education
	* Hon. Deputy Minister of Vocational Education
Officials Committee:
* Secretary to the Prime Minister - (Chairman)
	* Secretary, Ministry of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government
* Secretary, Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education
	* Secretary, Finance Commission
* Director General of National Budget
	* Director General of Establishments
* Director General - Department of Management Service
* Director General of Combined Service

title: Appointment to the post of Secretary to the Leader of the Opposition in Parliament
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister to appoint Mr. M.G.C.S. Ranasingha, Grade I Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving as a Senior Assistant Secretary of the Office of the Leader of the Opposition in Parliament, to act full time in the post of Secretary to the Leader of the Opposition in Parliament with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment to the Post of District Secretary/Government Agent of the Administrative District of Kandy
decision_details: - The Post of District Secretary/Government Agent of the Administrative District of Kandy has fallen vacant from 2024-11-25.  The proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government to appoint Mr. U.P. Indika Anuruddha Piyadasa, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving as Divisional Secretary, Ampara, to the Post of District Secretary/Government Agent of the Administrative District of Kandy with immediate effect, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointments for the Posts of Additional Secretary in the Prime Minister's	Office
decision_details:
- The proposals made by the Hon. Prime Minister to make the following appointments for 02 vacancies existing in the Posts of Additional Secretary in the Prime Minister's Office, were approved by the Cabinet. 

	  * 	   Appointment of Mr. J.M.I.R.K. Jayasundara, Special Grade Officer of	   the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving as an Additional 	  District Secretary in the Kurunegala District Secretariat, to a post of	   Additional Secretary in the Prime Minister's Office. 

		* 	Appointment of Ms. Chandani Sagarika Bogahawatta, Grade I	Officer  				of the Sri Lanka Planning Service, presently serving as a Director in the				Department of Project Management and Monitoring of	the Ministry of				Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to act full time in a post of 					Additional Secretary in the Prime Minister's Office.

title: Procurement of Essential Medical Supplies from the State Pharmaceuticals Manufacturing Corporation and Local Manufactures
decision_details:
- Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024-10-14 to purchase locally manufactured medicines and medical supplies from the identified local manufacturers for an ensuing period of one year. Accordingly, the Ministry of Health and Mass Media has prepared 04 lists of pharmaceuticals that could be provided by local manufactures who have signed Joint Venture Agreements with the State Pharmaceuticals Manufacturing Corporation, the local manufacturers who have signed Buy Back Agreements with the Ministry of Health and those who have not entered into agreements as of now. As such, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Health and Mass Media to award the following procurements, based on the recommendations submitted by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, having examined the said 04 lists.

*	To award the procurement for the supply of 42 pharmaceutical items to the State Pharmaceuticals Manufacturing Corporation, for a sum of Rs. 5,398.83 million.
*	To award  the procurement for the supply of 131 pharmaceutical items to the local manufacturers who have signed Joint Venture Agreements with the State Pharmaceuticals Manufacturing Corporation, for a sum of Rs. 16,611.42 million. 
*	To award  the procurement for the supply of 36 pharmaceutical items to the local manufacturers who have signed Buy Back Agreements with the Ministry of Health and Mass Media, for a sum of Rs. 9,022.10 million. 
*	To award the procurement for the supply of 130 pharmaceutical items to 24 newly selected local manufacturers, for a sum of Rs. 13,374.65 million.

title: Request for Supplementary Budget allocation for the year 2024 for the Road Projects under the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation
decision_details: - Since foreign loan disbursements for certain projects which were implemented through foreign debt financing have been temporarily suspended due to the recent economic crisis in the country, the provisions allocated under the foreign debt financing could not be fully utilized. Further, the expenses incurred under domestic financing have also been increased significantly due to the significant increase of prices in raw materials. As a result, a problematic situation has arisen due to the inadequacy of the provisions currently allocated to settle the bills submitted by the contractors. Considering the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation in this regard, it was decided to grant the approval of the Cabinet to present a supplementary estimate in Parliament to secure required additional provisions under local financing, in lieu of the savings in the provisions allocated under foreign debt financing for the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation for the year 2024.

title: 77th Independence Day Ceremony falling on February 04, 2025
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024 10 14 to appoint a Cabinet Committee under the chairmanship of the Hon. President to guide, direct and monitor the organizing of the 77th Independence Day Commemoration Ceremony, which falls on 04-02-2025. The proposal made by the Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government to appoint a Cabinet Sub-Committee under the chairmanship of the Hon. President and with the participation of the Hon. Prime Minister to provide necessary guidance in organizing the 77th Independence Day Commemoration Ceremony falling on 04 February 2025, including the Ministers in charge of the relevant subjects who have been appointed as Members of the Cabinet after the Parliamentary Election, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Restructuring of International Sovereign Bonds to restore Sovereign Debt Sustainability
decision_details: - In June 2024, the Government of Sri Lanka has reached a final agreement on debt restructuring with the members of Official Creditor Committee (OCC) of Sri Lanka's major bilateral lenders. In September 2024, an agreement has initially been reached in principle with the holders of International Sovereign Bonds, following the negotiations with Ad Hoc Bond Holders, a representative group of international investors and the Local Consortium of Sri Lanka on restructuring of approximately US$ 14.2 billion of sovereign debt. Accordingly, the proposal made by the President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to restructure the Sri Lanka's International Sovereign Bonds by way of exchanging the existing bonds for new bonds, after an analysis carried out by financial and legal advisors of the Government of Sri Lanka pertaining to the impact on the Sri Lanka's economy taking into account the matters on the composition of international sovereign debt of Sri Lanka, investors and settlement and as per the parameters pointed out through the Debt Sustainable Analysis by the International Monetary Fund as per the provisions of the Sri Lanka's IMF-supported Extended Fund Facility Programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Statement on financial performance of the Government submitted as stipulated in the provisions of Public Management Act, No.44 of 2024 - 3rd Quarter 2024
decision_details: - As stipulated in Section 53(1) of the Public Financial Management Act, No. 44 of 2024, on at least a quarterly basis, the Minister of Finance shall provide a Statement on Financial Performance including the revenue and expenditure, of the Government to the Cabinet of Ministers not later than forty five days after the end of each quarter and thereafter, publish the same in the website of the Ministry in charge of the subject of Finance. Accordingly, the Cabinet has granted its concurrence to the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to publish the Report on Financial Performance including cumulative revenue and expenditure reported by all the Special Spending Units, Ministries, Departments and District Secretariats for the 3rd Quarter ending on 2024-09-30, in the website of the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development.

title: Pre-election Budgetary Position Report - 2024 and the Mid Year Fiscal Position Report - 2024
decision_details: - The Pre-election Budgetary Position Report is issued in terms of section 52 of the Public Financial Management Act, No.44 of 2024, the Secretary to the Treasury should submit to the public, a Pre-election Budgetary Position Report containing information on the financial position of the country within three weeks of publishing a Declaration or an Order that a General Election be held to elect Members of Parliament. The said Report was published on the website of the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development on 2024 10 14. In terms of section 50 of the Public Financial Management Act, No.44 of 2024, the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development should submit to the public, the Mid Year Fiscal Position Report containing the information used as a basis for evaluating the mid-year fiscal performance of the Government as against the fiscal strategies set out in the Government's fiscal strategy, on the last day of October of the relevant year or on the date on which a period of 10 months from the passage of the Appropriation Act of the relevant year lapses, whichever date occurs later. The said Report was published on the website of the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development on 2024 10 31. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to table the Pre-election Budgetary Position Report - 2024 and the Mid Year Fiscal Position Report -2024 in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Preparation of the Budget for the year 2025
decision_details: - The new Government anticipates to prepare the budget for the year 2025 as a budget taking the initial steps towards the desired development, in a manner that will strengthen the people's confidence in the Government and fulfill the expectations of the public. Accordingly, Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to prepare the Budget for the year 2025 by obtaining proposals from all ministries, enabling to provide necessary provisions to implement the projects and programs identified by each Ministry under its purview, subject to the expenditure limits specified in the Public Financial Management Act, No. 44 of 2024 and the compliance to the Policy manifesto of the Government, and to present the Appropriation Bill for the year 2025 to Parliament on 2025 01 09 and conduct the Second Reading (Budget Speech) on 2025 02 17 and the Third Reading of the Budget Debate from 2025 02 27 to 2025 03 21.

title: Awarding the Contract for the procurement of 04 shipments of Gas Oil (0.05% M.S)
decision_details: - Bids have been called for the purchase of 04 shipments of Gas Oil (0.05% M.S) for the period from 2024 12 15 to 2025 06 14 from the registered suppliers of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation. Accordingly, bids have been submitted by 06 Bidders. The proposal made by the Minister of Energy, to award the relevant procurement to M/s BB Energy (Asia) Pte. Ltd, Singapore, as recommended by the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee after evaluating the said bids, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Nadu Rice shortage in the local market and the importation of rice in order to control the price of rice
decision_details: - Taking into account the tendency of price increase of rice and the existing shortage of Nadu Rice in the local market, the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development was requested at the previous Cabinet meeting to submit recommendations to the Cabinet in liaison with the Minister of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation and the Minister of Labour, consulting relevant parties. Considering the recommendations so submitted, approval of the Cabinet was granted to immediately import 70,000 metric tons of rice (Swarna variety) which is equivalent to parboiled Nadu variety of rice.

title: Submission of a Supplementary Estimate to Parliament
decision_details:
- It is required to make necessary provisions through a Supplementary Estimate for incurring and accounting certain essential expenditures in the ensuing period of the year 2024. Accordingly, certain expenditures that have been identified can be made through allocation adjustments within the approved expenditure estimate for the year 2024 and the relevant adjustments can be made without exceeding the overall expenditure limits approved by the Appropriation Act for the year 2024 and without any impact on the credit ceiling of the Government. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to submit a Supplementary Estimate amounting to Rs. 219,373 million to Parliament through a resolution for the following purposes, was approved by the Cabinet:

(i) 	Making provisions of Rs.130,000 million to the Department of Public Enterprises for the payment of interest subsidy to banks due to restructuring of the debt of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, which was transferred to the balance sheet of the Government of Sri Lanka.

(ii) 	Making provisions of Rs.18,000 million to the Department of Treasury Operations to account the exchange parity loss incurred on the balance of accounts held in the name of Deputy Secretary to the Treasury due to the appreciation of Sri Lankan Rupee against the United States Dollar.


 
(iii) 	Making provisions of Rs.32,641 million to the Department of Development Finance for the reimbursement of additional interest payments incurred by banks in providing special interest rates to Senior Citizens.

(iv) 	Making provisions of Rs.9,829 million to the Ministry of Education to account the value of the school uniform materials provided by Government of China as a Grant.

(v) 	Making provisions of Rs.8,331 million to the Sri Lanka Air Force to account and pay taxes for the value of 02 Aircrafts received by the Sri Lanka Air Force as a Grant from the United States of America.

(vi) 	Making provisions of Rs.1,400 million to the Department of Pensions for the payment of increased pension allowances.

(vii) 	Making provisions of Rs.3,213 million to the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development for the reimbursement of payments made by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka to financial/legal advisors in connection with the Debt Restructuring Process.

(viii) 	Making provisions of Rs.1,533 million to the Department of National Budget to account the emergency relief received as a Grant from the Government of China for the Ministry of Fisheries to provide relief for small-scale fishermen in Northern and Eastern Provinces.

(ix) 	Making provisions of Rs.10,826 million to the Department of National Budget to account the value of fuel stocks received by the Ministry of Health from the Government of Japan as a Grant for the needs of the health sector and payment of duties amounting to Rs. 5,225.5 million.

(x) 	Making provisions of Rs.1,800 million to the Department of National Budget for granting additional provisions to the Ministry of Education to increase the daily cost to be incurred per student from Rs.85/- to Rs.110/-, in connection with the School Nutrition Programme. 

(xi) 	Making provisions of Rs.400 million to the Department of National Budget for granting additional provisions to the Ministry of Defence to pay compensation for the renovation of damaged properties due to natural disasters.

(xii) 	Making provisions of Rs.1,400 million to the Department of National Budget for granting additional provisions to the Department of Prisons required due to increase of expenditure on diets as a result of the increase in the number of inmates in prisons of the Department of Prisons and the rising of the prices of food.

title: Submission of a Vote on Account to Parliament to continue the functions and Debt Servicing of the Government from January to April 2025
decision_details: - Although the new Parliament was summoned on 2024 11 21, there is no sufficient time to follow the statutorily mandated steps pertaining to the passage of the Appropriation Bill for the year 2025. Therefore, as stated in sub-section 23(1) of the Public Financial Management Act, No.44 of 2024, a Vote on Account should be presented in Parliament for the first 04 months of the year 2025, in order to allocate provisions for continuation of the ongoing projects and for the functioning of the public services. Accordingly, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development, to prepare a Vote on Account for the period of first 04 months of the year 2025, also including the expenses for recurrent expenditure and capital expenditure, public debt servicing and expenditure related to debt restructuring.

title: Appointment of Officers to the Higher Management of the General Treasury
decision_details:
- The Post of Director General of the Department of External Resources has fallen vacant due to the appointment of Mr. D. A. P. Abeysekara, Special Grade Office of the Sri Lanka Planning Service who served in the said Post, to a Post of Deputy Secretary to the Treasury with effect from 2024‑11‑06. The Post of Director General, Department of Project Management and Monitoring is also due to fall vacant, since Mr. N.S.M.P. Ranjith, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Planning Service is due to retire from the Public Service on reaching 60 years of age on 2024‑11‑10. A suitable officer has to be appointed to the Post of Director General of the Public Debt Management Office as well, scheduled to be established in the General Treasury. Accordingly, on a proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism, the Cabinet decided to make the following appointments:

*	Appointment of Mr. R.M.S.P.S. Bandara, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Planning Service, presently serving as an Additional Director General of the Department of External Resources, to the Post of Director General of the Department of External Resources with effect from 2024‑11‑06.

*	Appointment of Mr. S.S. Mudalige, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Planning Service, presently serving as the Director General of the Highways Division of the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation, to the Post of Director General of the Department of Project Management and Monitoring and for the continuation of the appointment to act in the Post of General Manager of Railways.

*	Appointment of Mrs. Udeni Udugahapatthuwa, Grade 1 Officer of the Sri Lanka Planning Service, presently serving as a Director of the Department of External Resources, to act in the Post of Director General of the Public Debt Management Office with effect from 2024‑12‑01, scheduled to be established in the General Treasury.

title: Implementing the Project on Development of a Sustainable Integrated Solid Waste Management and a Circular Economy proposed to be implemented focusing the Uva Province and the Northern Province on the Technical and Financial Assistance of Korea International Cooperation Agency
decision_details: - The Government of Korea has extended its willingness to award a financial grant of US$ 10.20 million, to implement a project during the period from 2024-2028 for the establishment of an Integrated Solid Waste Management Mechanism at local authority level in the Uva and Northern Provinces and for solving management issues related thereto. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Justice, Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Labour to implement the proposed project with the technical assistance of the Korea International Cooperation Agency and the financial assistance of the Government of Korea, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Term Contract for the Procurement of 05 Shipments of Gasoline 92 Unl during the Period from 2024-12-01 to 2025-05-31
decision_details: - Bids have been invited under two payment options viz., payment at the time of issuance from storage tanks and payment in thirty days after the B/L date through L/C from suppliers registered in the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation, for the supply of 05 shipments of Gasoline 92 Unl (1.5 million barrels) under a term contract during the period from 2024‑12‑01 to 2025‑05‑31.  Accordingly, 07 bids have been received and 03 bids have been rejected at the initial evaluation. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Energy to award the relevant contract to M/s Vitol Asia Pte. Ltd., Singapore under the payment in thirty (30) days after the B/L date through L/C payment terms, based on the recommendations of the Standing Technical Evaluation Committee and the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting a Service Extension of 06 months to Ms. Preethi Anoma Siriwardena, Director General of the National Child Protection Authority
decision_details: - Ms. Preethi Anoma Siriwardena, Director General of the National Child Protection Authority has retired from the Public Service with effect from 2024‑11‑02 on reaching 60 years of age. Several senior managerial positions of the National Child Protection Authority, such as the Deputy Director General, Director (Administration and Human Resources) and the Director (Finance) are vacant at the moment. Under the circumstances, the Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Women, Child and Youth Affairs, and Sports, to re‑employ Ms. Preethi Anoma Siriwardena in the said Post on contract basis for a period of 06 months, enabling to discharge the administrative and operational activities of the said Authority without interruption.

title: Appointment of an Officer to Act in the Post of Director General of Combined Services
decision_details: - The Post of Director General of Combined Services has fallen vacant due to the appointment of Mr. S. Aloka Bandara, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service who was functioning in the said post, to the Post of Secretary to the Ministry of Justice, Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Labour with effect from 2024‑10‑03. The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Justice, Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Labour, to appoint Ms. R.M.N.E.K. Ranasinghe, Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service, presently serving as Additional Secretary of the Parliamentary Affairs Division of the Ministry of Justice, Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Labour, to act in the Post of Director General of Combined Services, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of 1,996 Housing Units under the Chinese Government's Aid Programme for Low-Income earners
decision_details:
- It has been decided to construct 1,996 housing units under the Chinese Government's Aid Programme for Low-Income earners under 03 packages. In order to implement the said Project, bids have been invited from 08 bidders nominated by the Government of China. Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Rural and Urban Development, Housing and Construction, to award the contracts as follows, based on the recommendations submitted by the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee after evaluating the said bids:

* 	Package 01 - to award the contract for the construction of 575 housing units in Moratuwa and 108 housing units in Kottawa, to M/s China Railway 25th Bureau Group Co. Ltd.

* 	Package 02 - to award the contract for the construction of 586 housing units in Dematagoda and 112 housing units in Maharagama, to M/s China Harbor Engineering Company Ltd.

* 	Package 03 - to award the contract for the construction of 615 housing units in Peliyagoda to M/s Shanxi Construction Investment Group Co. Ltd.

title: Rehabilitation and Improvement of (B452) Walgama - Diyagama road section from 0+000km - 7+000km
decision_details: - The OPEC Fund for International Development has provided a loan of US$ 40 million for the improvement of Rakwana - Suriyakanda road. Using the balance of that loan amount, the Road Development Authority has invited bids for the rehabilitation and improvement of the road section from 0+000 km to 7+000 km of Walgama - Diyagama Road in the Colombo District,. 08 bidders have submitted bids for the purpose. Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation, to award the contract for the improvement of Walgama-Diagama Road in the Colombo District, to M/s.Maga Engineering (Pvt) Ltd., for an amount of Rs.2.44 billion (excluding VAT), using the remaining loan provisions of the Rakwana - Suriyakanda Road Project, based on the recommendation of the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee.

title: Procurement for the operation of Currency Exchange Counters at the Departure Walkway of the Bandaranaike International Airport, Katunayake
decision_details:
- Bids have been invited from Licensed Commercial Banks, Licensed Specialized Banks and Limited Registered Dealers in Foreign Currency Business approved by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka, following the Limited National Competitive Bidding Procedure in order to operate 05 Currency Exchange Counters at the Departure Walkway of the Bandaranaike International Airport, Katunayake. Bids have been submitted by 05 Institutions for the same. Accordingly, the recommendation made by the Minister of Transport, Highways and Civil Aviation to assign the operation of Currency Exchange Counters to the following Institutions for a period of 03 years, based on the recommendations of the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet. 

*	Counter No:25 - Bank of Ceylon for a sum of LKR 798.028 million + Taxes

*	Counter No:02 - Sampath Bank PLC for a sum of LKR 633.662 million + Taxes

*	Counter No:04 - Commercial Bank of Ceylon PLC for a sum of LKR 381.364 million + Taxes

*	Counter No:10 - Thomas Cook Lanka (Pvt) Limited for a sum of LKR 299.064 million + Taxes

*	Counter No:11- Hatton National Bank PLC for a sum of LKR 225.689 million + Taxes

title: Payments for certified bills under the 100,000km Road Rehabilitation Programme
decision_details: - 100,000 km Road Rehabilitation Programme with five-year project duration was commenced in 2020 and the bills amounting to Rs.28.37 billion remain to be settled under the said programme from the year 2023. A sum of Rs.20 billion has been allocated in the year 2024 for the essential road rehabilitation work under which 1,000 km has been identified for rehabilitation. The proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to manage the provisions allocated to the Ministry for the year 2024 but unutilized as yet, to settle the outstanding bills under these two programmes, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Distributing Uniform Materials provided as a Grant from the People's Republic of China, to School and Pirivena Students for the year 2025
decision_details: - The total requirement of school uniform materials for the year 2025 is about 11.82 million meters of fabric. The People's Republic of China has consented to provide the said total quantity, as a Grant. After the sample of materials, sent to the Ministry of Education, were tested by the Sri Lanka Institute of Textile and Apparel (SLITA), the said Institute has recommended that the fabric is suitable for use by school children. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Education, Science and Technology, to accept the Grant of the Government of China to provide uniform materials to all School and Pirivena Students for the year 2025, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Administrative and Operational activities of the Galle Face Green
decision_details: - At the Cabinet Meeting held on 2023‑04‑17, it has been decided not to grant permission to use the Galle Face Green, which is under the management and administration of Sri Lanka Port Management and Consultancy Services (Pvt) Ltd.,a subsidiary company of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, for activities other than religious purposes. It has been observed that it is appropriate to use the Galle Face Green as a more attractive and safe place for local and foreign tourists to roam freely as it was before 2023 and, subject to suitable criteria, for festive events, musical shows and other festivities, which people can participate freely and also to recover the administrative and maintenance cost of the Galle Face Green which is approximately Rs.2.5 to 3.0 million per month. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation, to take necessary action to operate the administration of the Galle Face Green in a more systematic and transparent manner based on the concept, “Clean and Green Galle Face Green”, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Contract for the supply of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) for the year 2025
decision_details: - Bids have been invited under the single-stage, two envelope method by following the International Competitive Bidding procedure, to procure Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) for Litro Gas Lanka Ltd for the year 2025. Only the two companies, M/s OQ Trading Limited and M/s Siam Gas Trading Pte. Ltd., have submitted bids for the purpose. The bid submitted by M/s Siam Gas Trading Pte. Ltd has been rejected at the technical evaluation. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Development, Policy Formulation, Planning and Tourism, to award the Contract for the supply of Liquefied Petroleum Gas for the year 2025, to M/s OQ Trading Limited, the substantially responsive bidder, as per the recommendations of the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Completion of the remaining work of the Auditorium in the Police Welfare Building
decision_details: - The contract for the construction of the Auditorium in the Police Welfare Building has been executed by Interwest Engineering and Construction Company as a sub contract under the project management of the Department Buildings at a total estimated cost of Rs.98.846 million. Arch International (Pvt) Limited has provided consultancy services for the said project. The said project has been suspended by the Department of Buildings on 2023‑02‑24 due to the failure of Interwest Engineering and Construction Company to complete the work within the scheduled time period. The Consultancy Services Institution has prepared and submitted a revised total cost estimate of Rs.122.921 million in keeping with the present rates to complete the remaining works of this project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to have the remaining construction works executed through the Department of Buildings under the revised total estimated cost in keeping with the original plan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting the land where the Southern Provincial Advisory and Extension Centre of the Tea Research Institute of Sri Lanka is functioning, on long term lease basis
decision_details: - The Southern Provincial Advisory and Extension Centre of the Tea Research Institute of Sri Lanka has been operating in Kottawa, Galle since 1961 and the extent of land presently enjoyed by the said Centre is 69.63 acres. This premises is used for tea field demonstrations for tea growers, officials related to the tea industry, university students and the students who follow training courses and school students. The proposal made by the Minister of Environment, Wildlife, Forest Resources, Water Supply, Plantation and Community Infrastructure to grant the said land on long term lease basis, enabling to maintain the said Centre more formally and productively, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of a Joint Application by Sri Lanka and Indonesia to obtain 	benefits under the 'Inter Regional Cumulation' included in the Developing 	Countries Trading Scheme of the United Kingdom
decision_details: - Subsequent to the UK's withdrawal from the European Union, the Developing Countries Trading Scheme (DCTS) is implemented from June 2023 in order to maintain the trade preferences granted under the Generalized System of Preferences (GSP) of the European Union. Sri Lanka has automatically become a beneficiary of the UK's DCTS, as it is a beneficiary of the EU GSP Scheme. As per the criteria under the said Scheme, in order to obtain the benefits of the relevant System of Preferences to the apparel productions in Sri Lanka, ready‑made garments are required to be made by using fabrics woven or knitted domestically, as materials. Since domestically woven or knitted apparel production was inadequate, the local apparel manufacturers have been unable to secure the benefits of the UK's DCTS at optimum level. However, according to the criteria of the Developing Countries Trading Scheme, when inputs/materials produced in a country of one regional group entitled to the preferential benefits are incorporated into a product manufactured by a country of another regional group entitled to the similar preferential benefits, provisions have been made available to treat them as a ready-made item manufactured by the country where the end product is made. The said criterion is known as Inter Regional Cumulation whereby exporters in both countries are able to accrue benefits. As per the said provisions, both ASEAN region (Regional Group I) and SAARC region (Regional Group II) are entitled to the above preferential benefits. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security, Cooperative Development, Industry and Entrepreneurship Development, to submit a single application adopting the provisions of Inter Regional Cumulation jointly by Sri Lanka and Indonesia and take necessary action to accrue the preferential benefits for both countries by obtaining inputs/materials required for the apparel industry from Indonesia and exporting Sri Lankan ready-made garments to the United Kingdom, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding between the Sri Lanka Institute of Biotechnology (Pvt) Ltd. and the Ohio State University of the United States of America
decision_details: - Sri Lanka Institute of Biotechnology (Pvt) Ltd is an Institute which comes under the purview of the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology, established with the sole shareholdership of the Treasury for the achievement of the objectives such as, establishing a centralized biotechnological background with modern technology, developing a culture of innovation to accelerate the biotechnology industry by providing incubation technology facilities for the innovators, developing the new biotechnology industry to meet the global market needs and introducing renewable medicines to the health sector in Sri Lanka. With the aim of promoting cooperation in the fields of research and higher education, it has been proposed to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the above Institution and the Ohio State University of the United States of America, with the intention of facilitating the research, innovation, education and cultural exchange. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Education, Science and Technology to sign the said Memorandum of Understanding between the two parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a Dispute Prevention and Resolution Mechanism to the Public Service
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑11‑20 to introduce a Dispute Prevention and Resolution Mechanism in the Public Service. Accordingly, the Public Administration Circular No. 05/2024 has been issued to implement the Dispute Resolution Mechanism in the entire Public Service. By the aforesaid Cabinet decision, approval has been granted to obtain technical and expert assistance of the International Labour Organization and in order to implement the said Mechanism, the International Labour Organization has requested project support from the United Nations Secretary General's Fund for Peacebuilding. Accordingly, US$ 2 million has been granted for the two programmes called “Public Sector Social Dialogue Programme” and “Social Dialogue Promotion Programme in the Private and Informal Economic Sectors” under the new project named “Social Dialogue for Peace and Crisis Prevention in Sri Lanka”. Cabinet noted the facts submitted by the Hon. Prime Minister in her capacity as the Minister of Justice, Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Labour stating that measures are being taken to implement the said programmes by an Inter-Sectoral Steering Committee co-chaired by the Secretary, Ministry of Justice, Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, Local Government and Labour and the Resident Coordinator of the United Nations.

title: Securing Funds through the Small Expenditure Financing Facility for Large Scale projects financed by the Asian Development Bank
decision_details: - Taking into account the context of the prevailing economic crisis in Sri Lanka, the Asian Development Bank has agreed to provide USD30 million from the Ordinary Capital Resources (Regular) of the Asian Development Bank under the Small Expenditure Financing Facility for the completion of the construction and post-construction work of the Moragolla Hydropower Project and the implementation of the complementary projects aimed at the development of renewable energy. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Energy to obtain the said loan amount under Treasury guarantees directly to the Ceylon Electricity Board in 02 installments, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Revision of the Limits of Raid Advance Account of the Commission to 	Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption
decision_details: - A Raid Advance Account is maintained to provide money for the raids carried out by the Commission to 	Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption and the maximum limit of expenditure of that advance account is Rs.50 million. Since the amount given as bribe cannot be determined precisely and as per the nature of the bribery complaints received recently, the amount demanded as the bribe is considerably very high, the relevant maximum limit of expenditure should be revised urgently. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to take necessary action to increase the maximum limit of expenditure of Raid Advance Account up to Rs.150 million, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of Chairman and Members of the Board of Directors of the National Transport Commission
decision_details: - As per the provisions of the National Transport Commission Act No. 37 of 1991, the said Commission shall consist of 8 members. In accordance with section 3(1) (a) of the said Act, three out of them are appointed as ex-officio members representing the Ministries in charge of subjects of Transport, Policy Planning and Finance. Subject to the criteria of section 3(1)(b) of the said Act, the Minister in charge of the subject of transport shall appoint five members with the approval of the Cabinet of Ministers and their term of the office is 03 years. Similarly, the Minister in charge of subject shall appoint the Chairman from among the members of Commission as per the provisions of the National Transport Commission Act No. 37 of 1991. As such, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation to appoint the following four persons as members of the National Transport Commission according to the provisions of section 3(1)(b), and to appoint Dr. Bandura Dilipa Witharana from among them as the Chairman of the National Transport Commission, was approved by the Cabinet.* Dr. Bandura Dileepa Witharana - Senior Lecturer of the Open University of Sri Lanka* Mr. W. Raviprasad de Mel - Senior Lecturer of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura* Dr. (Mrs.) Namali Taranga Sirisoma - Senior Lecturer of the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University* Mr. A.I.U. Perera - Commissioner of the Department of Inland Revenue

title: Appointment of Dr. T.M.J.Nilan Cooray to the post of Director General of the Central Cultural Fund
decision_details: - Due to the resignation of Professor Gamini Ranasinghe, who served as the Director General of the Central Cultural Fund, the said post is currently vacant. It has been identified that Dr.T.M.J.Nilan Cooray, who has local as well as foreign training and experience in the fields of Archaeology, Architecture and Archaeology Conservation and had led and guided a number of publication projects and academic researches, is suitable for that post. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs, National Integration, Social Security, and Mass Media to appoint Dr.T.M.J.Nilan Cooray to the post of Director General of the Central Cultural Fund on contract basis, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of Officers to the Higher Management of the General Treasury
decision_details:
