title: Awarding the Contracts for supplying of Aviation fuel for SriLankan Airlines
decision_details:
- The current operational contracts for aviation fuel supply at Frankfurt (FRA),	Incheon (ICN), Melbourne (MEL) and Sydney (SYD) airports are due to expire on 31 	October 2024. Therefore, limited international bids have been	invited to select the 	suitable suppliers of the said airports for a period of 02 years and for which 08 	aviation fuel supplying companies have submitted bids. Accordingly, the proposal 	made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the aircraft fuel supply 	contracts as follows, based on the	recommendations of the Technical Evaluation 	Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was 	approved by the Cabinet.




Airport
Name of Contractor




* Frankfurt (FRA)
Vitol Aviation BV


* Incheon (ICN)
World Fuel Services Trading DMCC


* Sydney (SYD)
Vitol Aviation BV


* Melbourne (MEL)
Vitol Aviation BV

title: Provisioning of high-speed satellite internet connection for SriLankan Airlines fleet
decision_details: - SriLankan Airlines currently operates a fleet of 13 aircrafts with internet facilities, enabling the passengers to use Wi-Fi facilities and GSM services on mobile phones. Since the air passengers have to experience low internet speed with the existing outdated internet facility, the need of providing a fast internet application facility has been identified. Ka and Ku bands are used for high-end connections and due to the high frequency range available, through Ka-band provides high data transfer at a speed. It has been recognized that the Ka-band connection is more suitable for high-speed Internet access, streaming services and other data-intensive operations. Accordingly, the proposal submitted by Viasat Company, the sole provider of Ka-band connectivity offering hardware, software and internet facilities with global coverage for commercial aircrafts, have been evaluated and recommendations submitted by the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee. The proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the Contract for the provision of Ka-band high-speed satellite technology Internet connection facilities for seven (07) A330-300 model aircraft of SriLankan Airlines Limited to Viasat Inc. for a period of 07 years, based on the said recommendations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for supply of Soy Bean and Maize for Sri Lanka Thriposha	Limited
decision_details:
- The annual maize and soybean requirement for thriposha production is about 12,000 MT and 6,000 MT respectively. Due to the current shortage of maize and soybeans, the annual supply requirement for thriposha production process cannot be met locally, therefore, the said need has to be met from abroad. Accordingly, bids have been invited for the supply of maize and soybeans under the National Competitive Bidding Procedure. Accordingly, the proposals made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to award the Contracts as follows  to the lowest substancially responsive bidders as per the recommendations of the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, after evaluating the said bids, were approved by the Cabinet.

*	Award of the procurement for supply of 6,000 MT of Maize to M/s KST Evergreen (Pvt) Ltd.

*	Award of the procurement for supply of 3,000 MT of soybeans to M/s SDK United Agri Ventures (Pvt) Ltd.

title: Adoption of the Charter for the Upcountry Plantation Community of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The Charter for the Upcountry Plantation Community has been drafted as a preliminary document to guide the Government's efforts to realize the Government's commitment for the full integration of the Upcountry Plantation Community into the wider Socio-Economic Structure of the country. By implementing the said Charter, it will be possible to address the challenges that the plantation community is constantly facing and to build an just society for them in Sri Lanka. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development to implement the Charter for the Upcountry Plantation Community of Sri Lanka was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the 8th Intake of the Interest Free Student Loans Scheme
decision_details:
- At the cabinet meeting held on 2023‑04‑24, it has been decided to appoint an Officials' Committee under the Chairmanship of a Deputy Secretary to the Treasury to submit recommendations regarding the implementation of the 8th Intake of the Interest Free Student Loans Scheme that has been commenced since 2017 for following Degree Courses in Non-State Higher Education Institutes and revision of  fees to be paid to the said Higher Education Institutes for the relevant courses. Therefore, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to implement the following recommendations submitted by the said Committee, was approved by the Cabinet:

*	Revision of course fees from the 8th Intake of the Interest Free Student Loans Scheme as per the recommendations of the Technical Consultation Committee appointed by the Ministry of Education.

*	Getting involved the National Savings Bank as well, in addition to the Bank of Ceylon and the People's Bank for the above scheme in order to reduce the financial risk that one bank has to bear .

*	Annual review and implementation of the loan interest of the Interest Free 	Student Loans Scheme subject to a minimum rate of 13% and to a interest rate of 6 months AWPLR+1%.

*	Enrollment of 7,000 students for each intake commencing from the 8th intake of the Interest Free Student Loans Scheme.

title: Training of 7,500 Teachers on Robotics and Artificial Intelligence
decision_details: - The Digital Transformation has been recognized as a very significant component by the National Education Policy Framework, and for this purpose, the assistance  by the public and private sectors has been encouraged in order to use Artificial Intelligence and New Technologies. Accordingly, as per a project proposal submitted by Skills College of Technology (SCOT CAMPUS), an experienced institution  of conducting courses on Information Technology, Mechatronics and Robot Technology,  a pilot project has been successfully carried out. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology and the Minister of Education to train 7,500 teachers in selected schools, covering all the provinces in relation to the STEAM concept including Information Technology, Biotechnology, Engineering Technology, Mathematics, through the Skills College of Technology (SCOT CAMPUS) in three stages, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Convention between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Austria for the Elimination of Double Taxation and Prevention of Fiscal Evasion and Avoidance
decision_details: - The Convention between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Austria for the Elimination of Double Taxation and the prevention of Fiscal Evasion and Avoidance with respect to Taxes on Income and on Capital has been drafted and initialed at staff-level having negotiated with the tax authorities of the two countries. In line with the recent Conventions on Elimination of Double Taxation entered into Sri Lanka, interests and royalties will be taxed at a rate not exceeding 10 percent of the gross amount. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to sign the said Convention at the State level and submit the said Convention and Protocol, to Parliament, in terms of the provisions of the Inland Revenue Act, No.24 of 2017, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Strategy to Promote the Commercial Fishing Industry in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - An Expert Committee has been appointed to explore and recommend possible strategies to promote high impact fisheries and sustainable practices in the Sri Lankan fishing industry. The said Committee has submitted its Report named “A Strategy to Promote Sustainable Export Oriented Commercial Fisheries to Support Sri Lanka's Envisaged Economic Transformation”. The said Strategic Framework has suggested strategic proposals to transform the fishing industry in Sri Lanka as a sector that will provide a major contribution for a sectoral growth of 12% and to earn an export revenue of USD 600 million annually by the year 2030, while ensuring the sustainability in line with the principle of Blue Economy. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Fisheries, to adopt the said Strategic Framework submitted through the said Report as the strategic Framework of the Government pertaining to Sri Lankan Fishing Industry and to implement the said Strategy in keeping with a formal Strategic Framework, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the proposed Skills Development Programme from the year 2025 onwards
decision_details:
- Cabinet Appointed Oversight Committee on the implementation of the National Education Policy Framework has submitted the following proposals to implement on priority basis:

(i)	To provide 50,000 job focused training scholarships annually, aiming high-demand industry specific jobs through the network of public or private Vocational Training Centres to be effective from 2025 under a Student Based Funding Scheme.

(ii)	To award 60,000 Opportunities of Vocational Training Courses annually targeting students engaged in secondary education.

Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Chairman of the Cabinet Appointed Oversight Committee on the implementation of the National Education Policy Framework to implement the said proposals and to allocate provisions by the General Treasury for the ensuing period of 05 years from the year 2025 so as to securing the provisions required for the same through the financial investment of Rs. 100 million already agreed and proposed to be implemented by the Asian Development Bank and the Government and to implement the National Education Policy Framework together with the Cabinet Appointed Oversight Committee appointed to implement the said Framework and the Ministry of Education, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing the opportunity to the employees attached to the Samurdhi Development Authority to be absorbed into the Department of Samurdhi Development
decision_details: - Employees who served attached to the then Samurdhi Development Authority have been provided with the opportunity at several occasions to be absorbed the then Department of Divineguma Development at their option, with a pension during the establishment of the Department of Divineguma Development by the Divineguma Act, No.01 of 2013. Nevertheless, it has been identified that there are approximately 3000 employees who were unable to revise their option on various grounds. Accordingly, the Cabinet granted its concurrence for the proposal made by the Hon. President to provide the opportunity to the said group of employees to be absorbed to the Department of Samurdhi Development in consultation with the Public Service Commission within the existing legal framework.

title: Introduction of a new Legislation on the Rights of the Indigenous People in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - The joint proposal made by the then Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms and the Minister of Buddhasasana Religious and Cultural Affairs pertaining to introduction of a new legislation on the the rights of the indigenous people in Sri Lanka was taken up for discussion at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑05‑22. In the instance, It has been decided that it would be appropriate to further analyze the Concept Paper submitted for the preparation of the Bill, with the participation of all relevant parties. Accordingly, the relevant preliminary draft has been further improved, having conducted several rounds of discussions under the chairmanship of the Secretary to the Prime Minister and with the participation of the officials of the Ministries entrusted with the subjects of lands, wildlife and forest conservation, environment and finance, the officers of the Attorney General's Department and the officers of the Legal Draftsman's Department as well as the parties interested in the relevant field. As such, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms and the Minister of Buddhasasana Religious and Cultural Affairs to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill based on the said preliminary draft, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Colombo Port City (Management of Condominium Property) Regulations No.03 of 2024
decision_details: - According to the Master Plan of the Colombo Port City, 51% of the gross floor area has been allocated for residential use which will lead to the development of Condominium Properties. Accordingly, it has been required to establish a regulatory body and to impose regulations to maintain common amenities and elements at an international standard, providing seamless living for owners and tenants of the Condominium parcels. The Colombo Port City (Management of Condominium Property) Regulations No.03 of 2024 have been published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2394/68 dated 2024‑07‑26 as per the provisions of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act No.11 of 2021. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotions to submit the said Regulations to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Reconstruction of Kurinchakerny Bridge on Kinniya-Kurinchakerny	Road
decision_details: - Bids have been invited under Single Stage One Envelope method for the contract of reconstructing the Kurinchakerny Bridge on Kinniya-Kurinchakerny Road from the remaining funds of the Project on Development of the Badulla - Chenkalady road under the Road Network Development Project funded by the Saudi Fund for Development. 09 bids have been received for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to award the said Contract to M/s ELS Construction (Pvt) Ltd, the lowest substantially responsive bidder as per the recommendations of the Cabinet Appointed Standing Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Printing of School Textbooks required for free distribution in the year	2025
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2024‑04‑01 has granted approval to print 71 types of textbooks out of the 317 types of textbooks which are to be printed for the year 2025. National Competitive Bids have been invited to print 246 types of remaining school textbooks required to be free distributed to the school children in year 2025.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to get printed the textbooks of the grades other than the Grade 1, 6 and 10 from the Printing Companies who have submitted the lowest substancially responsive bids as per the recommendations of the Cabinet Appointed Standing Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Administrative Arrangement between the Delegation of the European	Union arriving in Sri Lanka for observation of the Presidential Election -	2024, and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
decision_details: - The Chairman of the Election Commission has invited the European Union to send an Election Observation Mission to the country to observe the Presidential Election 2024. Administrative Arrangements should be signed between the European Union Delegation visiting Sri Lanka and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs before starting the Election Observation activities under the regulations of the said Union. Accordingly, the Administrative Arrangements relating to Observation of Presidential Election 2024 have been signed between the two parties on 2024‑08‑05 and the information presented by the Minister of Foreign Affairs in that regard were noted by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Undertanding between the United	Nations Institute for Training and Research and the Ministry of Foreign	Affairs
decision_details:
- The proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to enter into a Memorandum of Undertanding between the United Nations Institute for Training and Research and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs for a period of 03 years with the aim of establishing a cooperative framework necessary for facilitation of mutual benefits in the following areas, was approved by the Cabinet.

* 	Training and learning support related to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development.

* 	Training of Diplomats in areas such as conferences, diplomacy and multilateral negotiations, skills development in communication, mediation and leadership, content-based workshops and specialized courses in climate change and human rights.

* 	Conducting Trainings by the UNITAR Operational Satellite Applications Programme (UNOSAT) on the use of Geo‑information technologies (GIS) for disaster risk reduction and crisis management.

title: Purchase of Paddy by the Paddy Marketing Board - Yala 2024
decision_details:
- The harvesting of paddy in the Yala season 2024 has been started by now and the Cabinet has already granted approval to provide pledge loans to the small and medium - scale mill owners for upto a maximum of Rs.6,000 million through commercial banks to purchase paddy in the Yala season at a subsidized interest rate. The approval of the Cabinet has been granted to take action as follows, taking into consideration the proposals presented by the Hon. President and the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries, with the aim of increasing the competitiveness of purchasing paddy and encouraging the paddy production in the upcoming Maha season.

* 	Provision of Rs. 500 million to the Paddy Marketing Board to be able to actively participate in the Government's paddy buying programme in the Yala season 2024.

*	Purchase of Nadu paddy at Rs 105/- per kg, Samba paddy at Rs 115/- per kg and Keeri Samba paddy at Rs 130/- per kg by the Paddy Marketing Board.

* 	Increasing the fertilizer subsidy of Rs.15,000/- paid per hectare up to Rs.25,000/- per hectare, to encourage farmers to cultivate paddy, so that they can get a maximum yield in the upcoming Maha season.

title: Alienation of a plot of Land of the Polonthalawa Farm belonging to the National Livestock Development Board to the Geoffrey Bawa Foundation
decision_details: - The Manager's bungalow of the Polonthalawa farm belonging to the National Livestock Development Board has been designed by the renowned Sri Lankan  architect, Deshamanya Geoffrey Bawa. The Geoffrey Bawa Foundation has made a request to vest the said bungalow and the land of 5 acres where the said bungalow is located, on lease basis. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to vest the said Manager's bungalow of the Polonthalawa farm and the plot of land of 05 acres where the said bungalow is located with the Geoffrey Bawa Foundation, on lease basis, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Cooperation Agreement between the Sri Lanka Export Development Board and the International Finance Corporation (IFC) to facilitate Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) to become Exporters
decision_details: - It has been proposed to sign a Cooperation Agreement between the International Finance Corporation and the Sri Lanka Export Development Board in order to facilitate the development of new exporters under the New Exporter Development Programme of the Sri Lanka Export Development Board aiming to upgrade the Small and Medium Exporters with export potentiality to the status of  Exporters. The clearance of the Attorney General and the recommendations of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs have been received for the said Cooperation Agreement. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as Minister of Investment Promotion to sign the proposed Cooperation Agreement between the two parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transfer a plot of land for the Rights to Servitude and Services of the buyers of Condominium Units residing in Waterfront Properties (Private) Limited
decision_details: - The Board of Investment of Sri Lanka has granted a land plot of 3.03 acres for a period of 99 years to John Keells Holdings PLC or its nominee on a long term lease basis for the implementation of a mixed development project related to the tourism industry including the development of luxury condominium type housing facilities. Accordingly, an agreement has been reached between Waterfront Properties (Private) Limited, the nominee of John Keells Holdings PLC and the  Board of Investment of Sri Lanka, to implement the relevant project. As of now,  out of the 06 towers expected to be built under the project, 03 towers including 425 residential condominium/apartment units have been completed and commercial operations have also been started, and the construction of remaining 03 towers are being carried out. A land area in extent of 60.5 perches included in the leased land outside the land portion belonging to the condominium property, has been utilized to provide services of the condominium buyers. The said land section has been used for the construction of common facilities such as  television, telephone/telecommunications services, roads etc. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to transfer the rights to Servitude and Services traversing through the said land to the use of residential condominium buyers of Waterfront Properties (Private) Limited, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Sri Lanka’s National Strategy on Artificial Intelligence
decision_details: - Eventhough Sri Lanka has already achieved a significant progress on its digital transformation journey, has yet to make a substantial impact on the global Artificial Intelligence platform. The use of artificial intelligence in key sectors such as agriculture, health services and education has the potential to increase the productivity and enhance the Government services. Thus, it makes a powerful contribution to achieve a sustainable economic growth and eradicate poverty, and also paves the way to equally distribute the benefits of Artificial Intelligence throughout the society. Sri Lanka's National Strategy on Artificial Intelligence has been prepared with the aim of fostering a digitally empowered Sri Lanka through the development and use of Artificial Intelligence. Accordingly, by the year 2030, Sri Lanka is expected to be positioned as a regional hub for artificial intelligence thereby increasing its global competitiveness and economic resilience. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology to implement Sri Lanka's National Strategy on Artificial Intelligence, which has been prepared to achieve these objectives, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of the Financing Agreement for the Second Phase of the Development Policy Financing Programme
decision_details: - The World Bank supports Sri Lanka's comprehensive reform agenda through the Development Policy Financing Programme, in parallel with the International Monetary Fund's Extended Fund Facility. The programme is a two-year programme, and its first phase has been successfully completed in the year 2023. The World Bank has agreed to provide an amount of USD 150.6 million (equivalent to 200 million US dollars) of Special Drawing Rights (SDR) to support the implementation of the Reform Plan of the Government under the second phase of the Development Policy Financing Programme. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to enter into the relevant Agreement with the International Development Association of the World Bank Group in relation to obtaining the said financial facility, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Programme of mitigating the impact on the Fisheries Industry caused	due to the economic crisis and revival of the Fisheries Industry
decision_details: - The Covid‑19 pandemic followed by the economic crisis and the high fuel prices had an extremely negative impact on the Fisheries Industry in Sri Lanka. The owners of the fishing vessels have to bear a huge working capital for fuel on launching the vessels and as a result engaging the vessels in fishing operations has been limited. Therefore, it has been identified the need to provide relief for the fuel used in the fishing industry and thereby, quickly restoring the said industry. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies and the Minister of Fisheries to grant an allowance of the revival of fisheries industry to the vessel owners who use diesel as fuel to receive a sum of Rs.25/- per litre and to the vessel owners using kerosene as fuel to receive a sum of Rs.25/- per litre, subject to 15 litres per day for a maximum of 25 days per month, for a period of 06 months, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the Project implementation period of CHEC PORT CITY	COLOMBO (PRIVATE) LIMITED
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑08‑05 to extend the Project implementation period for CHEC PORT CITYCOLOMBO (PRIVATE) LIMITED with the exemptions applicable under the Strategic Development Projects Act, from 2024-09-07 to 2027-06-30. Accordingly, an order was published through Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2396/60 dated 2024-08-09 as per the provisions of the Strategic Development Projects Act, No.14 of 2008. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to present the said Order for approval in Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Term contract for the procurement of 03 shipments (2,100,000 Bbls+/-5%)of Murban Crude Oil during the period from 2024-11-15 to 2025-04-14
decision_details: - Bids have been invited from the registered suppliers of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation for the procurement of 03 shipments of Murban‑type Crude Oil (2,100,000 Bbls+/-5%) under the Payment prior to the date of quantity drawn (100% Ex.Storage Modality) during the period from 2024-11-15 to 2025-04-14. Only M/s. Vitol Asia Pte. Ltd., Singapore has submitted bids for this tender. Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee has recommended to award the Contract to that Company based on the recommendations of the Technical Evaluation Committee. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the relevant Contract, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Term contract for the procurement of 03 shipments (2,100,000 Bbls+/-5%) of Murban Crude Oil through a Letter of Credit issued by the Bank	of Ceylon on the basis of payment in 30 days during the period from 2024-11-15 to 2025-04-14
decision_details: - Bids have been invited from the registered suppliers of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation to purchase 03 shipments of Murban-type Crude Oil (2,100,000 Bbls+/-5%) through a Letter of Credit issued by the Bank of Ceylon on the basis of payment in 30 days during the period from 2024-11-15 to 2025-04-14. 05 Bids were received for this and the Special Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee has recommended the Bid submitted by the M/s.Vitol Asia Pte.Ltd., Singapore as the only responsive bid. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the Contract for the procurement of 03 shipments of Murban Crude Oil to M/s.Vitol Asia Pte.Ltd., Singapore, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expert Committee Report on the issuance of Tourists Visas Free-of-Charge
decision_details: - Approval has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑04‑25 to appoint an Expert Committee to examine matters on the methodology adopted by other countries pertaining to the issuance of tourist visas free-of-charge and submit a Report with recommendations. The Expert Committee appointed accordingly, has submitted a comprehensive Report, having examined matters on 08 countries competing with Sri Lanka in the tourism sector and the Hon. President brought the said Report to the notice of the Cabinet. Accordingly, the approval of the Cabinet has been granted to implement the recommendations of the said Expert Committee and to issue visas free-of-charge for identified maximum 35 countries to be validated for 30 days, for a period of 06 months commencing from 2024‑10‑01 based on the said recommendations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Orders issued as per the provisions of the Ports and Airports Development Levy Act, No.18 of 2011 to Parliament for approval
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑05‑29 has granted approval to remove the Ports and Airports Development Levy related to the HS Codes of the Tariff Liberalization Programme under the "Sri Lanka - Singapore Free Trade Agreement". Accordingly, the Order made as per the provisions of the Ports and Airports Development Levy Act, No.18 of 2011 has been published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2377/39 dated 2024‑03‑28. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the said Order, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing the fertilizer subsidy for farmers cultivating in paddy lands for Maha Season 2024/25
decision_details: - It has been observed that there is a possibility to ensure the food security in the country and to enhance the productivity in crops by providing a fertilizer subsidy for farmers for paddy and other field crops cultivating in paddy lands during the Maha Season 2024/25. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to import fertilizer through State Fertilizer Company Limited, the state-owned fertilizer company, and the private sector for the Maha Season 2024/25 and to sell at a competitive price to the farmers and to provide a financial subsidy of Rs.15,000.00 per hectare for maximum of cultivated two hectares for paddy cultivation and other crops through the Department of Agrarian Development, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing a Fertilizer Subsidy to the tea growers for rehabilitation of tea cultivation
decision_details: - It has been found that the facts such as increase of the prices of fertilizer and ban on the chemical fertilizer during the past period have caused to the decrease of use of fertilizer thereby declining the tea production. Therefore, it has been a timely requirement to provide a relief to the tea growers in view of promoting the use of fertilizer to increase the tea production. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to provide a 50kg bag of chemical fertilizer with a concession of Rs.4,000/- through State Fertilizer Company Limited, the state-owned fertilizer company, to the tea growers, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: The Contract for Rehabilitation and Improvement of Access Roads to Kandy Multimodal Transport Terminal (KMTT)
decision_details: - Under the Kandy Multimodal Transport Terminal Development Project, bids have been invited for the award of the contract for the rehabilitation and improvement of access roads to the Kandy Multimodal Transport Terminal, following the local competitive bidding procedure. 10 bids have been received for the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to award the relevant contract to Maga Engineering (Pvt.) Ltd, the substantially responsive bidder, as per the recommendations of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding Contracts for Passenger and Ramp Handling Services of SriLankan Airlines
decision_details:
- The contract for passenger and Ramp Handling Services at Dammam, Jeddah and Riyadh airports in Saudi Arabia is due to expire on 2024‑12‑31, while the contract for passenger and Ramp Handling Services at the Guangzhou Airport in China is due to expire on 2025‑01‑31. Therefore, bids have been called under the limited international bidding procedure to select suitable service providers. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to award the relevant contracts to the following service providers who have substantially responded for a contract period of 03 years, as recommended by the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, having evaluated the bids received, was approved by the Cabinet. 

*	to award the contracts for Dammam, Jeddah and Riyadh in Saudi Arabia to Swissport Saudi Arabia Limited.

*	to award the contract for Guangzhou Airport in China to Guangzhoe International Airport Co. Ltd.

title: Operation of Travel Services Counters at the Arrival Public Concourse (Lobby) at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake
decision_details:
- Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited has invited bids for the operation of six (06) Travel Services Counters at the Arrival Public Concourse (Lobby) at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake and 12 bids have been received for that. The proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to grant permission for the following bidders who have responded substantially and submitted highest quotations, to utilize the said premises for a period of 03 years, as recommended by the Technical Evaluation Committee and the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, having evaluated the said bids, was approved by the Cabinet:

title: Construction of a new building for the National Institute of Business Management
decision_details: - The head office of the National Institute of Business Management, which operates as a Self-Financing establishment, is located at Vidya Mawatha, Colombo 07, and owing to inadequate room facilities, 02 private buildings located nearby have been acquired on lease basis and courses are being currently conducted for about 3,000 students. A proposal has been made to construct a new building complex with modern facilities for the institute so that more students could be provided educational facilities and new academic courses could also be introduced. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to acquire a plot of Government or private land located nearby the head office of the National Institute of Business Management, using the funds of the Institute and construct a new building complex in the said plot of land, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of “Students' Artificial Intelligence (AI) Clubs” to the Education System
decision_details: - It has been found that it is appropriate to provide opportunities for school students to engage in studies related to the artificial intelligence in order to achieve the goals of creating citizens who can face future global trends and obtaining their effective contribution to the economic development. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology and the Minister of Education to implement “Students' Artificial Intelligence (AI) Clubs” as a pilot project with the participation of students studying from Grade 6 to 9 in 100 selected schools and to extend this programme in the coming years to the other schools as well, based on the progress of the said project as an initial step, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Application of 'Aswesuma' Welfare Benefits Criteria for the Plantation Worker Families living in Line Rooms
decision_details: - The Welfare Benefits Board currently implements the 'Aswesuma' Benefits Scheme and the selection of the relevant beneficiaries is carried out as per the Welfare Benefit Payment (Selection of Persons Eligible to Receive Payments) Regulations No.1 of 2022 made under the Welfare Benefits Act, No. 24 of 2002. Individuals or families who fulfill the eligible criteria prescribed under the said Regulations are entitled to receive 'Aswesuma' benefits. In the plantation sector, the extended families of plantation workers often reside in shared line rooms due to the unavailability of individual housing within the estates. According to the current practice, all individuals living in the line rooms are treated as one family unit, irrespective of the number of separate families cohabiting in these spaces and this situation seems disadvantageous for the said families. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President to direct the Welfare Benefits Board to pursue action taking into account the actual plantation worker families living in line rooms in determining the eligible criteria for the 'Aswesuma' Scheme under the Welfare Benefit Payment (Selection of Persons Eligible to Receive Payments) Regulations No.1 of 2022, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposals to revise salaries in the Public Service
decision_details:
- Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑05-27 to appoint an Expert Committee to review the salaries, wages, and other allowances in the public sector and submit a Report with recommendations for implementing the proposals to revise the salaries in all sectors of the public service through the Budget 2025. Accordingly, the Expert Committee appointed under the Chairmanship of Mr. Udaya Senevirathne, Former Secretary to the President has negotiated with the Government Officers and major trade unions in the public sector and an Interim Report has been submitted having analyzed the relevant information. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to grant policy approval for the following proposals recommended by the said Report and to implement the said proposals having included them into the Budget 2025, was approved by the Cabinet.

* 	Classification of all posts in the entire public sector under 04 Main levels 	and  classification of recruitment qualifications into sub-categories based on the Sri Lanka Qualification Guide (SLQF) and National Vocational Qualification (NVQ) and taking into account the relevant job role, responsibilities and attracting employees with skills for the special jobs and keeping them in jobs.

* 	Following the Sri Lanka Qualification Guide as basic qualifications for recruitment for the Primary Service categories as well and following the appropriate selection procedures on the service requirement based on the National Vocational Skills.  

* 	Recruitment for all other service categories only through formal competitive examinations and interview methods.

* 	Accordingly, expeditious revision of existing approved recruitment procedures as appropriate.

* 	Payment of Rs. 25,000/- per month as the cost of living allowance to all the Government employees (subject to revision once in every 03 years), adding all the allowances such as, various adjustments made to the cost of living allowances and the allowances already added,  considering 2025 as the base year.

* 	Increasing the minimum Initial monthly salary of the Public service by a minimum percentage of 24% and taking the gross salary with cost of living allowance as Rs.55,000/- and adjusting the basic salary for all other posts accordingly.

* 	Implementation of this new Salary and Allowance Procedure for all the public institutions except Business State Companies and Banks.

* 	Taking measures to limit the total number of employees in the public service to Ten lakhs (1,000,000) or less, by 2030.

* 	Accordingly, introducing a methodology for the administration of the Government (E-Governance) in every possible field of the entire public service , through Digitalization and Automation and giving the priority of investment for that, within 03 years from 2025. 

* 	Implementation of a Medical Insurance Scheme including all the employees and retirees of the public sector, being entitled to the most attractive benefits with a minimum monthly contribution of Rs. 1000/- , from January 2025. 

* 	Obtaining services by following the prescribed methodologies so as to maximize the efficiency and minimizing the cost burden of the Government through methodologies such as Outsourcing whenever possible.

* 	Implementation of the restructuring programme for conversion of the identified Government Departments/Corporations/Statutory Institutions into Public Liability Companies listed in the Stock Market.

* 	Conduct a proper work study and take action to conduct a scientific study on  the entire public sector staff and services in year 2025.

* 	Accordingly, preparing the performance indicators for all the public servants and provide salary increments based on their progress.

* 	Providing salary increments entitled for the public officers retired before year 2020 and revising their pension and resolving the relevant anomalies. 

*   	Providing the Cost of Living Allowance to the retirees, equivalent to 50 % of the Cost of Living Allowance provided for the public officers engaged in active service, from January 2025 onwards. 

* 	Implementation of the Salary System, subject to the management of these expenditures within the existing tax policy and implementation of the proposed Salary System from 2025-01-01 in stages, taking into consideration the fiscal space as well.

title: Revision of Water Tariff
decision_details:
- The National Water Supply and Drainage Board has been implementing the existing water Tariff from 2023‑08‑01 and approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2024‑07‑15 to review the tariff system and implement the tariff policy and formula. Since the electricity charges have been reduced by the Ceylon Electricity Board from 2024‑07‑16 and considering the reduction in the cost of fuel, chemicals and interest, there is a possibility of reducing the water charges by a certain percentage. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development to revise the water charges as mentioned below, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Designate COLOMBO MARINA DEVELOPMENT (PRIVATE) LIMITED as a Primary Business of Strategic Importance
decision_details: - COLOMBO MARINA DEVELOPMENT (PRIVATE) LIMITED, a fully owned company of Browns Investment PLC, has been leased out 04 land plots within the Authority Area of the Colombo Port City for the Marina Development Project. The project has been designed with a Capitainerie with a full capacity which can accommodate 243 vessels, club houses for guests, retail outlets including food and beverages, entertainment venues, event spaces and car parking spaces. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion, to designate COLOMBO MARINA DEVELOPMENT (PRIVATE) LIMITED, as a Business of Strategic Importance as per the provisions of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, No.11 of 2021, and to grant exemptions and incentives for the said Business, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proceeds of Crime Bill
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑04‑25 to prepare the Proceeds of Crime Bill in line with the Report of the Committee to develop the Policy and Legal Framework and draft provisions of the proposed law on Proceeds of Crime. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Hon. President to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Publishing the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (Amendment)	Bill
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2022-05-02 has granted approval to amend the National Water Supply and Drainage Board Act. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has also been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Minister of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development to publish the said (Amendment) Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Pinnawala - Kitulgala Tourism Zone
decision_details: - A provision of Rs. 750 million has been allocated through a Budget Proposal of 2024 to the Ministry of Tourism and Lands for the development of the Pinnawala-Kitulgala Tourism Zone. The Department of National Planning has recommended to implement several Infrastructure Facilities Development Projects that have been identified under the same. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to implement the Projects identified with related to the Pinnawala-Kitulgala Tourism Belt Development Programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed Framework for leasing of lands to develop an internationally	recognized School, University and Hospital in Colombo Port City
decision_details: - Section 6(1)(c) of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, No. 11 of 2021, has entrusted the power to the Commission to lease the lands located within the territory of Colombo Port City and the Government marketable lands which has been vested with the Commission. Accordingly, the Colombo Port City Economic Commission has invited proposals to select the investors for the development of projects of School, University and Hospital in the Colombo Port City. Asiri Port City Hospital (Private) Limited and Gateway International School (Pvt) Ltd. have submitted a proposal to invest approximately USD 100 million for the Hospital,  USD 25 million for the school and  USD 25 million for the University. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to enter into Agreements for the lease of plots of land for the Hospital, School and University as per the provisions of Section 6(1)(c) of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Repatriation of Export Proceeds into Sri Lanka Rules No. 01 of 2024 under the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Act, No. 16 of 2023
decision_details: - Exporters, representatives of exporters and certain government agencies have submitted requests to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka to relax the existing Rules of Export Proceeds, i.e. "Repatriation of Export Proceeds into Sri Lanka Rules No. 01 of 2022 (as amended)". With the enactment of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Act, No. 16 of 2023, new Rules should be issued to fulfill the requests of the stakeholders.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the Repatriation of Export Proceeds into Sri Lanka Rules No. 01 of 2024, published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2391/02 dated 2024-07-01, made under the provisions of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Act, No. 16 of 2023, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.10 of 2024,	issued under the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969, for	approval of Parliament - (Importation of Spices by Approved Enterprises	for Processing and Re-export)
decision_details: - The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to submit the Imports and Exports (Control) Regulations No.10 of 2024 made under the provisions of the Imports and Exports (Control) Act, No. 1 of 1969 and published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No. 2393/36 dated 2024-07-18, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Ratification of the Sri Lanka - Thailand Free Trade Agreement
decision_details: - The Sri Lanka-Thailand Free Trade Agreement was signed by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security of Sri Lanka and the Minister of Commerce of Thailand on 2024-02-03 and the said Agreement was tabled in Parliament on 2024-07-12. As per Article 14.10 of the said Agreement, the Agreement will come into force on the thirtieth day after the date of the  notification of the second party, after the last notification made by one party to the other party stating that the internal legal requirements and procedures have been completed. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to ratify the Sri Lanka - Thailand Free Trade Agreement, based on the above matters, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Award of the Contract of Package 1R and 1S of Section 03 of the Central	Expressway Project
decision_details: - The construction of the Section-03 of the Central Expressway Project is divided into 19 Contract packages, of which 17 packages from 1A to 1Q have already been awarded. Bids have been invited from the eligible local construction firms for Contract Packages 1R and 1S on competitive basis, on the recommendations of Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee. Accordingly, the proposals made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to award the Contract Packages 1R and 1S to M/s MAGA Engineering (Pvt) Ltd, the lowest substancially responsive bidder based on the recommedation of the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Installation and maintenance of solar panels on the roofs of railway	stations and buildings belonging to the Department of Sri Lanka Railways
decision_details: - There are more than 300 railway stations owned by the Department of Railways and it has been identified that it is more appropriate to commence a project to generate electricity by solar power on those roofs. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to take necessary action to implement the said Project as a Public-Private Partnership Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction and Renovation of Houses damaged by disasters including floods and strong winds due to the activation of the Southwest Monsoon
decision_details: - 454,625 individuals of 120,215 families have been affected by the disasters including floods, strong winds which occurred due to the activation of Southwest Monsoon of the country from 2024‑05‑15 and 172 complete house damages and 20,075 partial house damages have been reported.  Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as  the Minister of Defence to construct houses for the families of 172 completely destroyed houses in the same place or any other safe place and to grant compensation to 20,075 partially damaged houses, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Selection Criteria Framework for Investments in Drinking Water Sector in 	Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Selection Criteria Framework for Investments in Drinking Water Sector in Sri Lanka have been prepared by the Ministry of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development under the supervision of a Steering Committee comprising of experts in the relevant field, stakeholder agencies and academia. The proposal made by the Minister of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development to implement the said Criteria Framework, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Protection of the site associated with Miocene Limestone deposit with 	archaeological value at Aruvakkalu, Puttalam
decision_details: - Geological and archaeological research have proved that sedimentary rock deposit containing archaeological factors belonging to very distant period between 26-195 million years has been located in the Aruwakkalu area of the Vanathavillu Divisional Secretariat of the Puttalam District. Fossil evidence of  more than 40 species of extinct and existing fauna belonging to Miocene Epoch have been found from the limestone located in the said land. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Buddhasasana, Religious and Cultural Affairs to name an area in extent of 10 hectares as an archaeological reserve as per the provisions of the Antiquities Ordinance, No. 9 of 1940 and the Antiquities (Amendment) Act, No. 24 of 1998 in order to protect the area, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of the Sri Lanka Coastal Zone and Coastal Resources Management Plan - 2024-2029
decision_details: - In terms of the provisions of the Coast Conservation Act, No. 57 of 1981, it is required to prepare and implement a Coastal Zone and Coastal Resources Management Plan in order to manage the coastal zone in Sri Lanka and the said plan should be updated once in every five (05) years. Accordingly, the  'Sri Lanka Coastal Zone and Coastal Resources Management Plan - 2024- 2029' has been prepared by amending the plan prepared and implemented in the year 2018. The proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to implement the said plan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Providing new Housing Units on resettlement basis for the houses of estate workers located irregularly within the Urban Development Project Site at Millewawatta, Horana
decision_details: - Action is being taken by the Urban Development Authority to grant a blocks of land from the land located at Millewawatta, Horana for the development projects such as the Medical Drugs Manufacturing Village Project, Relocation of Welikada Prison Project, Small and Medium Scale Industries Project and the establishment of a University Village Project  under the Mahapola Higher Education Scholarship Fund. Old estate housing units located irregularly within the proposed land have to be removed expeditiously in order to implement the said projects. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to remove 54 irregular housing units existing being a hindrance to the proposed development projects in the Millewawatta land and provide the occupants of the said housing units each with a block of land in extent of 10 perches with a house free of charge, under 02 phases, on freehold basis, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Domestic Ginger Production and Price Regulation
decision_details: - At the Cabinet Meeting held on 2024‑07‑15, the  Secretary, Ministry of Agriculture and Plantation Industries and the Secretary, Ministry of Trade, Commerce and Food Security have been instructed to jointly explore the possibility of reducing the retail price of ginger to a price affordable to the consumers in the domestic market while facilitating the  ginger production and submit a Report with appropriate recommendations in that regard. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries; and the Minister of Trade Commerce and Food Security to import 3,000 MT of raw ginger through the Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation in a phased out manner, within the ensuing period of 03 months, based on the recommendations in the Report submitted, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into Memoranda of Understanding / Collaboration Agreements between Sri Lankan Universities and Overseas Universities
decision_details:
- It has been proposed to sign Memoranda of Understanding / Collaboration Agreements among Sri Lankan Universities and overseas Universities with a view to elevating Sri Lankan Universities to the top level of world ranking and developing higher educational collaborations. The said Memoranda of Understanding / Collaboration Agreements have been prepared in conformity with the observations and recommendations of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Department of National Planning and the Department of External Resources. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to grant covering approval to sign the Memorandum of Understanding between the University of Peradeniya and the Board of Trustees of the University of Illinois of the United States of America for the mutual participation in the fields of education and research and to sign the following  Memoranda of Understanding and Collaboration of Agreements, was approved by the Cabinet.

*	Collaboration Agreement between the University of Jaffna and the University of Oxford in United Kingdom with the objective of capacity  building, conducting of training programmes, and conducting of research.

*	Memorandum of Understanding between the University of Peradeniya and Johns Hopkins University, United States of America with a view to conducting joint research in the field of nursing, educational exchange of students between the two countries and/or development of educational programmes related to the field. 

*	Memorandum of Understanding between the University of Sri Jayewardenepura and Hunan University of Chinese Medicine, of the People's Republic of China regarding the exchange of student-academic staff, with the aim of strengthening collaboration in the field of Pharmacy education.

*	Memorandum of Understanding between the University of Moratuwa, and the University of Maryland of the United States of America to enter into joint activities on mutual agreement with the aim of sharing scientific knowledge and cultural traditions at the global level.

*	Memorandum of Agreement between the University of Sri Jayewardenepura and the Meiji University in Japan with the objective of exchanging academic staff for the advancement in the field of education and research. 

*	Memorandum of Understanding between the University of Peradeniya and the Association of Commonwealth Universities of the United Kingdom for the Higher Education Scholarship Programme implemented under the Ocean Country Partnership Programme Scholarships.

*	Memorandum of Understanding between the University of Kelaniya and Nālandā University in India to develop academic cooperation and strengthen historical, cultural and intellectual ties between the two parties.

*	Memorandum of Understanding between Buddhist and Pali University and Vietnam Buddhist Academy with the objective of developing cooperation in the field of academic research.

title: National Climate Spatial Data Development Project
decision_details: - Owing to the impacts of climate change, variability and extreme events, Sri Lanka's people, livelihoods, ecosystems, built infrastructure and investments are at a significant risk. In order to reduce that risk, a Climate Resilient Investment Roadmap for Sri Lanka has been formulated. In its implementation, the creation and improvement of a National Climate Spatial Data System has been identified as a fundamental and an essential step. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to implement the National Climatic Spatial Data Development Project together with M/s PROCLIME PTE. LTD. of Singapore, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Eliminate the Pension Anomalies in the Public Sector
decision_details: - Pension anomalies have arisen for certain group of pensioners due to the periodic salary revisions made by the Government as well as various policy decisions taken by the Cabinet. Accordingly, it has been observed that some injustice has been caused to the Government officials who retired from 2016 01 01 to 2020 01 01, and by removing the said salary anomaly, it will be possible to provide relief to about 83,000 retired Government officials. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to revise the pension of the said retired Government Officers so as to receive a maximum of Rs.2500/-, based on the salary, in accordance with the Schedule I of the Public Administration Circular No.03/2016 dates 2016 02 25, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Re activating a Special Interest Scheme on Fixed Deposits of Senior Citizens
decision_details: - At present the interest rate on fixed deposits has depreciated significantly to 8.5%. As a result, majority of the senior citizen account holders have withdrawn their deposits. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to provide the annual interest rate of 10% for a period of 02 years for the fixed deposits of senior citizens over 60 years of age who deposited up to a maximum of one million rupees, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Submission of the Regulations made under the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, No.11 of 2021, to Parliament
decision_details:
- The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to submit the following Regulations made under the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, No. 11 of 2021 and published through the following Gazette Notifications, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet:

*	Colombo Port City (Offshore Banking - Preliminary) Regulations, 	No.04 of 2024, published through the Gazette Extraordinary 	Notification No.2394/67 dated 2024 07 26.

*	Colombo Port City (Offshore Banking - Prudent Management and Confidence) Regulations, No.05 of 2024, published through the Gazette Extraordinary Notification No.2394/66 dated 2024 07 26.

title: Memorandum of Understanding between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute and the Institute for Diplomatic Studies of Egypt
decision_details: - With the aim of nurturing and improving the historical friendship between Sri Lanka and Egypt, it has been recognized the need to mutually strengthen the Diplomatic Training Institutes of the two countries in order to exchange diplomatic knowledge between the two countries. Both parties have reached a compromise for facilitating the exchanging of diplomats, academics, officials, experts as well as researchers and also to share knowledge by arranging studies and conferences. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the Bandaranaike International Diplomatic Training Institute of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka and the Institute for Diplomatic Studies of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Arab Republic of Egypt, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the contract of site clearing at the Kankasanthurai Cement Factory by removing unusable materials scattered in the factory premises
decision_details: - Bids have been invited following the National Competitive Bidding Procedure to collect iron and other metal parts scattered over the cement factory site located in Kankasanthurai and clean the factory premises. Six (06) bidders have come forward for this procurement, which was operated under the direct supervision of the Ministry of Industries, and three of them have been rejected due to disqualifications per the bidding documents. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to award the said procurement to M/s. Luminex PLC, substantially responsive lowest evaluated bidder as per the recommendations of the Cabinet Appointed procurement committee, was appointed by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into a Memorandum of Understanding between the Sri Lanka Institute of Development Administration and the National Centre for the Good Governance of India to train the Executive Officers belonging to All Island Services
decision_details: - During the official visit of the Hon. President to India in July 2023, an agreement has been reached to implement skills and develop capacities in the public service, in Sri Lanka in partnership with the National Centre for the Good Governance of India, at the bilateral discussions held with the Prime Minister of India, Mr. Narendra Modi. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding between the Sri Lanka Institute of Development Administration (SLIDA) and the National Centre for Good Governance (NCGG) of India, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the Project implementation period granted to CHEC PORT CITY COLOMBO (PRIVATE) LIMITED with Strategic Development Project Concession
decision_details: - Construction of the Colombo Port City, a project identified under the Strategic Development Projects Act, No.14 of 2008 was entrusted with the CHEC PORT CITY COLOMBO (PRIVATE) LIMITED in year 2016. The proposal made by the President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to extend the project period till 2027-06-30 in order to complete the remaining work of the said Project and commence its commercial operations, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the National Building Research Organization by an Actin Parliament
decision_details: - In terms of the Cabinet Decision dated 2021-10-05, the Legal Draftsman was instructed to prepare a Bill to provide a legal recognition for National Building Research Organization. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the National Building Research Organization Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter, to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Proposed City Campus of Technology, Dambulla of General Sir John	Kotelawala Defence University
decision_details: - General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University has planned to establish a City Campus of Technology in Dambulla to expand its services to civil students in Central, North Western, North Central and Eastern Provinces. It is planned to acquire the Administrative Building Complex in Dambulla city belonging to the Urban Development Authority on lease basis without constructing new buildings for the proposed City Campus of Technology, Dambulla and to administer the proposed City Campus of Technology as an independent institute governed under the Board of Management of the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University. Accordingly, the proposal made by the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to establish the said City Campus of Technology, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of Futsal Indoor Stadiums at Commercial Level
decision_details: - Futsal is a football-based game played on an artificial court and an indoor stadium with dimensions of 40 x 20 meters and height of 4 meters is used for this game. At present, several indoor stadiums have been built in urban areas in Sri Lanka. Since there is a high demand for this sport, it is expected to expand the sport Futsal by providing the land to a private investor on lease basis under the Public Private Partnership procedure and using the state-owned stadium premises and lands. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Sports and Youth Affairs to select a private investor following the Government Procurement Guildlines for the construction of futsal stadiums on lease basis for a maximum of 30 years, within the identified state-owned lands and stadium premises and to construct two artificial futsal tracks provided by the said investor as a Grant of the Government of Pakistan in Torrington and Sugathadasa Stadiums, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Agreement on assigning equipment between the International Centre forResearch in Agroforestry and the Department of Export Agriculture
decision_details: - The Knuckles Project which is funded by the Green Climate Fund and receives technical assistance by the International Centre for Research in Agroforestry, is implemented by the Ministry of Irrigation to strengthen the climate resilience of subsistence farmers and agricultural plantation communities residing in the vulnerable river basins, water shed areas and downstream of the Knuckles Mountains. A Soil Spectroscopic Laboratory is to be established in the Department of Export Agriculture as one of the components operated under the above Project. The International Centre for Research in Agroforestry has agreed to provide the necessary equipment for that purpose. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries to enter into an agreement between the above institution and the Department of Export Agriculture to obtain the said equipment, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Resettlement of unauthorized dwellers residing in Kelaniweli Railway Reserve from Pagiriwatta Railway Station to Padukka Railway Station
decision_details: - The unauthorized dwellers residing in the railway reserve from Maligawatta Loco junction to Padukka Railway Station are resettled using the local funds under the Colombo Suburban Railway Project and the resettlement of the unauthorized dwellers in the section upto Kirulapana Railway Station has been completed so far. A large percentage of the residents of Railway Reserve in the section from Pagiriwatta Railway Station to Padukka Railway Station have been living insecurely and illegally in the Railway Reserve for over 30 years, out of which about 350 families have been identified for resettlement. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Transport and Highways to provide housing facilities for the said families by using the housing units of the Colombage Mawatha Housing Complex belonging to the Urban Development Authority and the Housing Complex being built in the Kottawa Malapalla area by the Railway Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: National Policy on Child Day Care Facilities
decision_details: - The National Child Protection Authority has introduced the National Guidelines for Child Day Care Centers in the year 2017 with a view to ensuring that all Child Day Care Centers located throughout the Island follow the same operating procedure and introducing a formal registration and supervision mechanism. Accordingly, the National Policy on Child Day Care Facilities has been prepared to implement the child day care service in a uniform manner in every Province and to ensure the introduction of a formal regulatory and monitoring mechanism. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment to implement the said National Policy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increasing the efficiency and quality of the Public Service
decision_details:
- It has been identified that it would be appropriate to integrate the information technology systems in the Public institutions with a view to enhancing the efficiency and quality in the public institutions as well as discharging duties effectively and optimum manner by minimizing the duplication errors and the verification of information. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to take action as follows when entering data to the information technology systems regulated/ developed by all Public Sector Institutions including State Corporations and Statutory Boards, was approved by the Cabinet.

*	making it compulsory to use the National Identity Card number to recognize a Sri Lankan citizen who is older than 15 years.

*	making it mandatory to use the Passport number to recognize a foreign national.

*	making it compulsory to use the Business Registration Number to recognize the identity of institutions and the National Identity Card Number of Sri Lankan members of Owners/Board of Directors of such institutions and the passport of number of foreign members.

*	ensuring data standardization enabling to share the relevant data formally with the other Public Sector Institutions.

title: Establishment of a Regional Centre for Maritime Studies in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Taking into account the maritime security and the various initiatives taken by Sri Lanka in that regard as a member of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA), the Government of France has identified Sri lanka as the most appropriate location to establish a "Regional Centre for Maritime Studies" in order to circulate the knowledge and procedures obtained through the common studies throughout the Region. It has been proposed to establish the proposed Centre at the General Sir John Kotelawala Defence University and to obtain the necessary assistance and infrastructure facilities for the same from the Naval and Maritime Academy at Trincomalee. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to enter into a Bilateral Agreement between the Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of France pertaining to the establishment of the proposed "Regional Centre for Maritime Studies", was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Indonesia - Sri Lanka Preferential Trade Agreement (ISLPTA)
decision_details: - Second Trade Negotiating Committee Meeting on Indonesia - Sri Lanka Preferential Trade Agreement was held on 16th and 15th July 2024 in Colombo. Accordingly, the Cabinet noted the matters furnished by the Hon. President to the effect that both parties have agreed to conclude the negotiations on Indonesia - Sri Lanka Preferential Trade Agreement by December 2024 and to sign the said Trade Agreement by March 2025.

title: Flood Situation in Kolonnawa
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2024 06 03 has decided to appoint a Committee under the Chairmanship of District Secretary, Colombo to look into the root causes affecting the floods in the Kolonnawa area and submit a Report with necessary recommendations to avoid the recurrence of such situation and to prepare a comprehensive development plan for the re-organization of the Kolonnawa city. Accordingly, the said Committee has submitted 16 recommendations including the Report prepared by the Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation to identify the causes for floods in the Divisional Secretariat Division of Kolonnawa and avoid the recurrence of such situation, and the Kolonnawa City Development Plan and Kotikawatta - Mulleriyawa City Development Plan being prepared by the Urban Development Authority, within 04 months. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. President to implement the said recommendations through the relevant responsible institutions after a proper study and to appoint a Committee under the Chairmanship of the Hon. Prime Minister to provide necessary guidance and supervision in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introducing a new Act for the National Agency for Public-Private	Partnership
decision_details: - The National Agency for Public-Private Partnership is expected to work jointly with the international organizations in respect of developing and managing the Public-Private Partnership programmes/projects and to identify such programmes and implementing those programmes in collaboration with the Public Sector Institutions. Legal validity should be enforced in order to run the said Agency more effectively and it is required to develop a legal framework regarding the relevant Partnership agreements as well. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill for the said purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Importation of eggs for the price stabilization of the local market
decision_details: - In terms of the Cabinet Decision dated 2024-03-18, Sri Lanka State Trading (General) Corporation has imported 224 million eggs as of now. 95% of these  has been distributed to the consumers at an affordable price of Rs. 37/- per egg through the Lanka Sathosa outlet network and the deadline given for importing eggs has ended by 2024-04-30. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security to import the required stocks of eggs so as to stabilize the market price of eggs during the upcoming Ramadan and Christmas festival periods as well and to supply eggs required for the industry of bakery products including cakes, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Enactment of the new Constitution for Sri Lanka Cricket
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2024‑02‑19 has granted approval to appoint a Committee headed by the Justice Mr. K.T. Chithrasiri, retired Judge of the Supreme Court to draft a new Constitution for Sri Lanka Cricket complying to the recommendations of the Report of the Cabinet Sub-committee appointed under the chairmanship of the Minister of Foreign Affairs to study the issues faced by Sri Lanka Cricket and submit the recommendations to the Cabinet. Accordingly, the new Constitution for Sri Lanka Cricket has been drafted by the said Committee. The joint proposal made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Minister of Power and Energy, Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment and Minister of Public Security to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to confirm and implement the proposed Constitution for Sri Lanka Cricket, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendments to the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, No. 11	of 2021
decision_details: - It has been identified the need to amend the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act in order to increase the viability of the Colombo Port City as a globally competitive Special Economic Zone by eliminating the obstacles to commence business operations indicated by the investors who are hoping to engage in businesses in the Colombo Port City. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to amend the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, No. 11 of 2021 by incorporating the relevant amendments, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Commission for Truth, Unity and Reconciliation in Sri Lanka Bill
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2024‑07‑15 to prepare a new Bill by amending the Commission for Truth, Unity and Reconciliation in Sri Lanka Bill, taking into account the  facts presented by the interested parties regarding the said Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill drafted by the Legal Draftsman. Therefore, the joint proposal made by the President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence; the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms; and the Minister of Foreign Affairs, to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter, present the same in Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amending the National Transport Commission Act, No.37 of 1991
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022‑09‑22 to amend the National Transport Commission Act, No.37 of 1991. Accordingly, the Legal Draftsman has prepared a Bill and the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the same.
