title: Integrated Development Plan for Bingiriya Area
decision_details: - Bingiriya Export Processing Zone is being developed into a fully-fledged export processing zone complete with industrial and investment zones, common facilities, access roads, internal roads and other relevant infrastructure. 157 acres of land under Phase I and 282 acres of land under Phase II of the said plan will be developed and an additional 666 acres have been identified for development under Phase III. In order to maximize the economic benefits of this Export Processing Zone, it has been planned to develop Iranawila and Chilaw areas as a tourism hub, to construct a Golf Course in Chilaw and to construct a road connecting Bingiriya Export Processing Zone with Iranawila tourism hub in parallel with the said project. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to to implement an integrated development plan for the Bingiriya area and to entrust the Task Force which has already been appointed to supervise and coordinate all development activities under the said plan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Updating and revising the license fees prescribed by the Firearms Ordinance (Chapter 182) No. 33 of 1916 and the Firearms (Amendment) Act No.22 of 1996
decision_details: - In terms of the provisions of the Firearms Ordinance No. 33 of 1916 and the Firearms (Amendment) Act No.22 of 1996, the Ministry of Defence issues firearms on licenses for agricultural and non-agricultural purposes and an annual tax is levied in respect of the same. The number of firearms issued so far by the Ministry of Defence is 34,318 and approximately Rs 45 million is credited to the General Treasury annually as license fees. Although the Ministry of Defence has taken necessary action to fully amend the Firearms Ordinance No. 33 of 1916 and the Firearms (Amendment) Act No.22 of 1996 to suit with timely requirements, it has been found necessary to amend the relevant license fee to suit with the present day needs until the aforesaid amendments are made. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to expeditiously amend subsection (1) of section 24 and section 34 of the Firearms Ordinance so as to pursue action accordingly, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Revenue Administration System for Sri Lanka Excise 	Department (RASED)
decision_details: - Although the Sri Lanka Excise Department is a revenue-generating Department, inefficiency of the old systems available with the Department to assist for its revenue administration functions has resulted in deficiencies such as the related loss of revenue and irregularities as well as it has led to the difficulty in accessing the information required by public and other relevant parties. Similarly, problematic situations have emerged in working together with information systems of other Institutions. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to introduce a Revenue Administration System for Sri Lanka Excise Department with a view to installing more efficient and productive Information Communication Technology System in order to carry out the basic functions such as exchange of all data, risk management and revenue reconciliation, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Awarding the Construction Supervision and Contract Administration Consultancy Contract for 28 sites in Phase II of the Reduction of Landslide Vulnerability by Mitigation Measures Project
decision_details: - The Reduction of Landslide Vulnerability by Mitigation Measures Project which is implemented by the National Building Research Organization is a project with 5 components. Under its first component, 127 places prone to landslides will be structurally stabilized and construction work has been completed on 24 sites under its Phase I. Under its Phase II, civil works contracts relating to landslide mitigation in 32 places belonging to the Kalutara, Rathnapura and Matara Districts have already been awarded. Out of the remaining 71 places, landslide mitigation civil works have been designed to carry out in 28 places belonging to Kandy, Kurunegala, Kegalle and Matale Districts (under Package number 5) through 5 contracts. Expressions of Interest have been invited following the National Competitive Procurement Procedure to select a Consultant for the construction Supervision and Contract Administration of the civil works in Package No.05. Accordingly, after evaluating all the proposals received, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence to award the contract for the provision of consultancy services for Package No. 5 to Resources Development Consultants (Pvt.) Ltd., Sri Lanka, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Introduction of a new law on Reciprocal Recognition, Registration and Enforcement of Foreign Judgments
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2022 07 18 to prepare a Bill to introduce a new law for Reciprocal Recognition, Registration and Enforcement of Foreign Judgments and to repeal the Reciprocal Enforcement of Judgments Ordinance No. 14 of 1921. Accordingly, the Bill on the Reciprocal Recognition, Registration and Enforcement of Foreign Judgments, incorporating the provisions for recognition and registration of a foreign judgment awarded for the dissolution or annulment of a marriage or separation of the parties to a marriage, has been prepared by the Legal Draftsman. The clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the said Bill. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to publish the Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter submit the same to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rescue, Rehabilitation and Insolvency Bill
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2023 06 26 to the Law Commission to discuss with the relevant parties and prepare a preliminary draft in order to introduce a unified Insolvency Law. Accordingly, with the technical expertise of the World Bank and in consultation with interested government and private sector stakeholders, the Law Commission has prepared a preliminary draft as a basis for the preparation of the Rescue, Rehabilitation and Insolvency Bill. The joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a bill for the relevant purpose based on the said preliminary draft, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Procurement for the Supply, Delivery and Construction of 220kV 2nd underground Cable from Kerawalapitiya Grid Sub Station to Colombo Port Grid Sub Station
decision_details: - It has been identified that it is very much essential to construct the 2nd underground Cable from Kerawalapitiya Grid Sub Station to the Colombo Port Grid Sub Station to supply electricity to meet the most essential commercial energy requirements for the Port City Development, Port Terminal Development and Mega scale mixed development projects in the Colombo metropolitan area. Accordingly, approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2021 09 13 to call for bids for the project of Supply, Delivery and Construction of 220kV 2nd underground Cable from Kerawalapitiya Grid Sub Station to Colombo Port Grid Sub Station. Accordingly, after evaluating the bids received, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to award the relevant procurement to Consortium of Jiangsu ETERN Co. Ltd, China & LS Cable & System Limited (LS Cable) Korea which has been recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee as the substantially responsive lowest evaluated bidder, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Capacities of Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) 	under the Long Term Generation Expansion Plan (LTGEP)
decision_details: - In order to achieve the target of meeting 70% of the country's electricity demand from renewable energy resources by 2030, it is imperative to absorb the targeted renewable energy capacities which will be generated through the projects expected to be implemented during the period of 2024-2030 to the National electricity Grid. The Government has focused special attention to develop the wind and solar potentials in the country and with the gradual increase of variable Renewable Energy integration to the power system, a more flexible power system is required to ensure the reliability of the system. As an appropriate method for the purpose, Battery Energy Storage Systems has been identified under the Long Term Generation Expansion Plan. Based on the recommendations of the Committee appointed to examine and submit recommendations regarding the application of that system during the period of 2024-2023, the proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to develop identified battery capacities to connect to the national electricity grid through private investments or public-private partnership methods, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Obtaining the Affiliated membership of the Foundation for Environmental	Education for the project of establishing Blue Flag Beaches in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Various programmes have been introduced to protect the environment of the coastal areas crucial for the tourism industry and to ensure the safety and health conditions of the tourists visiting coastal regions. The Blue Flag Beach Certification Programme is one of the prominent programmes out of those programmes and is also a popular eco-friendly brand among the tourists. The Blue Flag Certification is issued under this programme for the beach in concern on meeting 32 criteria under four (04) main elements of water quality, environmental management, environmental education information and the people's safety. The Blue Flag Certification is issued by the Foundation of Environmental Education in Denmark and in order to issue the Blue Flag Certificates in Sri Lanka, it is necessary to have an organization in this country that has obtained the affiliated membership of the said institution. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to obtain the affiliated membership of the Foundation of Environmental Education in Denmark to the Marine Environment Protection Authority for two (02) years and enter into a Collaborative Agreement with the Foundation for Environmental Education for that purpose, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the National Hospital, Galle
decision_details: - Teaching Hospital, Karapitiya functions as the main health center that provides tertiary care services except for maternity care services to the patients in the Southern Province and adjacent provinces and the primary and secondary healthcare institutions in those provinces refer patients to this hospital for specialized services. The Professorial Unit has been established at the Teaching Hospital, Karapitiya for teaching purposes of the Faculty of Medicine and the Faculty of Allied Health Sciences of University of Ruhuna. Accordingly, this hospital provides teaching and training facilities annually to around 1,100 medical undergraduates of the University Ruhuna, around 500 nursing students of the Nursing Training School, Galle and nearly 100 physiotherapists, pharmacists and medical laboratory technologists. With the increasing of the bed capacity up to 2,858 by the end of this year, the Teaching Hospital, Karapitiya will become the largest tertiary care centre second only to the National Hospital of Sri Lanka in Colombo. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to designate the Teaching Hospital, Karapitiya as National Hospital, Galle, categorizing the same as well as a National Hospital in addition to the National Hospital, Colombo and the National Hospital, Kandy, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Taking over the Base Hospital, Pottuvil by the Central Government and	developing as a specialized hospital for Medical Tourism in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - Base Hospital, Pottuvil which had been providing services since early 19th century, is one of the oldest hospitals in Sri Lanka. Considering the current demand for health facilities in the area, it has been identified the appropriateness of converting the above hospital into a Base Hospital providing integrated health care with paying ward facilities for tourists, palliative care services, elderly care services and Ayurvedic treatment facilities for tourism. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Health to vest the Base Hospital, Pottuvil which is currently under the purview of the Ministry of Health-Eastern Province, with the Ministry of Health with the concurrence of the Governor of the Eastern Province and make the said hospital function as the Integrated Health Care Institution in the South-East region of the country including all the necessary facilities for the promotion of the Medical Tourism, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Tripartite Agreement between the Government of Sri Lanka and CHEC 	Port	City Colombo (Pvt) Ltd
decision_details: - A Tripartite Agreement has been signed among the then Ministry of Megapolis and Western Development, Urban Development Authority on behalf of the Government of Sri Lanka and CHEC Port City Colombo (Pvt) Ltd in 2016, for implementation of the Colombo Port City Development Project. According to the said Agreement, the target completion date of the Project is 2025-06-05. Since it is observed that the Project will not be completed on the scheduled date due to reasons as However, due to the Covid -19 pandemic that prevailed and financial constraints of the Project company and the inability to generate sufficient revenue to meet its obligations to the creditors, the Project company has submitted a request to extend the time period of completion of the Project by two (02) years. Taking into consideration that request, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to extend the implementation time period of the Colombo Port City Development Project up to 2027-06-05 and sign an Addendum among the current parties to the said Tripartite Agreement; the Ministry of Investment Promotion and Colombo Port City Economic Commission on behalf of the Government of Sri Lanka and CHEC Port City Colombo (Pvt) Ltd, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Japanese Grant Aid for Human Resources Development Scholarship	Programme - 2024
decision_details: - The Government of Japan offers Master's Degrees and Doctorate Degree opportunities to the executive level officials in the public sector in Sri Lanka under the Japanese Grant Aid for Human Resources Development Scholarship Programme. Three Frameworks have been completed under this Programme from year 2010 to 2021 and its Fourth Framework has been started in 2022 and is scheduled to end in year 2025. Under this Programme, 225 and 17 opportunities have been offered up to now to study Postgraduate courses and PhD courses respectively and the Government of Japan has agreed to provide a grant assistance of Japanese Yen 304 million (approximately Rs.578 million) for the third batch of the Fourth Framework. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to sign the relevant Exchange of Notes with the Government of Japan to obtain that grant assistance and enter into an agreement with the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) in that regard, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Economic Transformation Bill
decision_details: - Approval in principle has been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2024‑03‑25 for the initial draft of the Economic Transformation Bill and the Legal Draftsman have been instructed to prepare and submit the formal Bill promptly incorporating the amendments submitted by the Attorney General. The Attorney General's clearance has been received for the Bill that has been prepared accordingly. The proposal made by the Hon. President to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter submit it to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Project to Grant State lands to war heroes for residential purposes
decision_details: - Circular instructions have been issued from time to time by the Commissioner General of Lands on approval of the Cabinet on the procedure to be followed in allotting State lands for residential purposes to the war heroes of the Tri-Forces, Sri Lanka Police and Department of Civil Security who have sacrificed their lives, gone missing, disabled while serving in the war front, retired and those who are still engaged in active service. It has been observed that the concessions offered to the war heroes with the approved procedures at present are not adequate and the real economic value of the said lands is not depicted due to the restrictive factors prevailing in the legal instruments with conditions for the lands in possession. Therefore, the proposal made by the Hon. President to take necessary action to revise the existing system by incorporating solutions to the problems that have arisen due to the current system when granting lands to the war heroes, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Acceleration of Rural Development Programmes
decision_details: - Provision of Rs. 212.59 billion has been allocated through the Budget 2024 to several ministries under 50 proposals for the sectors identified as in need of expeditious development. Projects related to 13 of those proposals are being implemented under the Presidential Secretariat. Due to the economic crisis prevailed in the last few years and having to halt certain development programmes initiated with foreign aids until the completion of debt restructuring process, the rural communities have been deprived of the benefits of the development programmes that had been planned to be implemented at the rural level. In particular, requests have been received from the various parties for the speedy completion of development projects such as rural roads, bridges, small tanks, canals development, rural enterprise development programmes as well as rural schools, hospitals, low-income housing and rural water supply. As a remedy to the above, the proposal made by the Hon. President to submit a proposal to Parliament to use the anticipated funds saved from the programmes that have been allocated under the Presidential Secretariat, to complete the essential development work that are implemented at the rural level and the rural development tasks which have been halted halfway, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Technology Promotion Bill
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2023‑12‑18 to make necessary institutional reforms for digital transformation and to prepare a concept paper to amend the Information and Communication Technology Act, No. 27 of 2003. Accordingly, a concept paper has been prepared to introduce new legislation for digital transformation, and it has been proposed to establish a Technology Innovation Council and a Digital Transformation Agency. The proposal made by the Hon.President to introduce the Technology Promotion Act by repealing the Information and Communication Technology Act No. 27 of 2003 and to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill based on the concept paper that has been prepared, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Appointment of 1,000 Officers belonging to the Sri Lanka Education Administrative Service, the Sri Lanka Teacher Educators' Service and the Sri Lanka Principals' Service to the Post of Commissioned Officer of the National Cadet Corps
decision_details: - The National Cadet Corps has been established under the Ministry of Defence as a supplementary force under Part V of the Mobilization and Supplementary Forces Act No. 40 of 1985. Officers in the Ministry of Education and school students are recruited respectively as officers and cadets of the said Corps. In order to further promote the cadet activities in the education sector, it has been intended to conduct a basic training course to recruit officers belonging to the Sri Lanka Education Administrative Service, Sri Lanka Teacher Educators' Service and the Sri Lanka Principals' Service to the  National Cadet Corps and it has been planned to recruit 1,000 officers in Grade I,II and III of the said services and appoint them as Commissioned Officers after a basic training. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and the Minister of Education to formally select 1,000 qualified officers belonging to Sri Lanka Education Administrative Service, Sri Lanka Teacher Educators' Service and the Sri Lanka Principals' Service and appoint them to the Post of Commissioned Officer after providing them with a basic training under 03 batches, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Implementation of Power Wheeling Facility for Electricity Customers
decision_details: - The approach to collectively utilize the electricity network of electricity transmission and distribution to provide electricity to a place which require electricity is known as Power Wheeling Facility. Under the Power Wheeling Facility, it enables the electricity consumers to utilize their own energy plants situated elsewhere using the existing electricity network by minimizing the electricity cost effectively, subject to payment of a charge. Since there are no legal provisions to implement said system in Sri Lanka, a Committee has been appointed to conduct a detailed study pertaining to the provision of that facility. The proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to implement the Power Wheeling Facility only for new renewable energy projects, based on the recommendations of the said Committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Commencement of G.C.E (Advanced Level) classes immediately after the completion of the G.C.E (Ordinary Level) Examination
decision_details: - Following the conclusion of the G.C.E (Ordinary Level) Examination, the Department of Examinations takes at least 03 months to release the results of the said exam. Dropping out of students from school education during this period has resulted a decline in student enrollment to pursue G.C.E (Advanced Level) thereby creating various social problems as well. Taking into account the said matters, it has been identified that it would be appropriate to commence academic activities of Advanced Level in schools just after the completion of the G.C.E (Ordinary Level) Examination in the year 2024, enabling the students to manage their time efficiently and to provide teachers with adequate time period to cover the G.C.E (Advanced Level) syllabus. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to commence G.C.E (Advanced Level) classes for students who sat for the G.C.E (Ordinary Level) Examination for the year 2023 in May 2024 immediately after the said examination, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Giving priority for the students of the Advanced Level Vocational Stream when providing vocational training in National Vocational Qualifications (NVQ level 4)
decision_details: - Students are given the opportunity to study Advanced Level Vocational Stream irrespective of their passing/failing at the G.C.E (Ordinary Level) Examination and at present, the said stream is in operation in 604 schools covering almost all Educational Divisions. Under the said stream, general subjects which develop soft skills should be followed in Grade 12, whereas, in Grade 13, students are provided with the opportunity to follow a NVQ Level 4 course for 06 months and obtain an on-the-job training of 06 months. 17 Vocational Training Institutions operating under 07 ministries have entered into Memoranda of Understanding with the Ministry of Education to continue NVQ level 4 courses for those students. As there are currently about 50,000 students registered to study under the Vocational Stream, it has been found the necessity to give priority to those students by all the Vocational Training Institutions operating under the the Government to provide relevant vocational training. Accordingly, Cabinet approved the proposal made by the Minister of Education, to make it a mandatory task of the Vocational Training Institutions operating under all ministries to provide vocational training to the students who study Advanced level Vocational Stream and give priority to Vocational Stream students when enrolling students in the NVQ 4 courses of those Institutions annually and provide facilities required for training.

title: Implementation of a Voluntary Retirement Scheme for the Staff of the Sri Lanka Savings Bank
decision_details: - The National Savings Bank, as of now, has decided to acquire the assets of the Sri Lanka Savings Bank which became a fully owned subsidiary of the National Savings Bank in the year 2019, and to absorb its employees. Accordingly, the absorption process of the employees is currently underway and it has been decided to introduce a Voluntary Retirement Scheme as an alternative and to make a payment for the employees who retire voluntarily, taking into account the market factors. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to implement the said Voluntary Retirement Scheme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Institutionalizing the Results-based Management in the Public Sector
decision_details: - The Department of Project Management and Monitoring in collaboration with Line Ministries have prepared “Ministerial Results Frameworks” of 10 Ministries and institutions coming under their purview, under which a high amount of budgetary provisions is allocated. Said “Ministerial Results Frameworks” will ensure the achievement of development targets within the purview of the relevant institutions in a timely manner and achievement of intended outcomes, while adhering to the responsibilities of the hierarchy of each Ministry. Further, it is expected that this would also pave the way for a result-oriented institutional structure that measures the effectiveness of investments made to address citizen's needs urgently. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to entrust the responsibility of achieving the targets containing in the designed Ministerial Results Frameworks with the Secretaries to relevant Line Ministries and to assign the responsibility of supervising the performance of such activities to the National Operations Room, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of the 484 MW of Wind Power Plants in Mannar and Pooneryn
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2022‑03‑07 to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding for the development of Wind Power Plants in Mannar and Pooneryn by M/s Adani Green Energy Limited, India. Accordingly, Cabinet Appointed Negotiation Committee has been appointed to evaluate the Project Proposal submitted by the above company. The proposal made by the Minister of Power and Energy to determine the value of US$ 8.26 cents per Kilowatt hour as the final tariff (subject to payment in Sri Lankan Rupees as per the actual exchange rate) for the electricity generated under the proposed project and to award the tender to M/s Adani Green Energy SL Limited for purchasing of electricity for a period of 20 years, based on the recommendations of the said committee, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Medical Ordinance
decision_details: - The Cabinet at its meeting held on 2023‑10‑09 has granted approval to implement the recommendations submitted by the Committee appointed under the Chairmanship of the Secretary to the Prime Minister to submit recommendations to amend the provisions of the Medical Ordinance to formulate a National Policy including standards and criteria to be based for the recognition of Medical Degree courses of the internationally recognized Universities,  in Sri Lanka and to suit with the present day needs. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General has been received for the Bill prepared by the Legal Draftsman to amend the Medical Ordinance based on the said recommendations. The proposal made by the Minister of Health to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and submit the same thereafter to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the National Teachers Council
decision_details: - It has been proposed through the National Education Policy Framework to establish a National Teachers Council in parallel with other professional service categories and international best practices for the professional advancement and enhancement of quality of teachers through continuous professional development. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Education to instruct the Legal Draftsman to prepare a Bill to establish a National Teachers Council based on the initial draft prepared having lengthy discussions with the relevant stakeholders in the field of education, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Digitization of the General Education in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - As per a project proposal submitted pertaining to the digital transformation of the general education system in Sri Lanka, the Government of China has extended its willingness to provide funds for the said purpose. A feasibility study relating to the implementation of the said project has also been carried out as of now. Through the proposed project, it is expected to provide Delivering Class Rooms, Receiving Class Rooms to schools and a Data Centre, Studio Room and a Conference Room to the Ministry of Education in order to operate those functions. It will enable to get the support of the said equipment to carry out effectively and efficiently the activities of implementing the blended learning systematically, sharing resources, providing the knowledge of teachers with special teaching skills for the students in schools when necessary, avoiding the problematic situations that arise when there is a shortage of teachers and facilitating the proposed education reforms. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to implement the proposed project, based on the relevant feasibility study Report, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Penal Code and the Code of Criminal Procedure Act to	prohibit Corporal punishment in all spheres
decision_details: - The Convention on the Rights of the Child to which Sri Lanka is a party, sets out the Civil, Political, Economic, Social and Cultural Rights of the Child. Article 19(1) of the Convention on the Rights of the Child mentions that the States Parties shall take all appropriate legislative, administrative and educational measures to protect the child from all forms of physical or mental violence, injury or abuse, neglect or negligent treatment, maltreatment or exploitation, including sexual abuse, while in the care of parents, legal guardians or any other person who has the care of the child. The United Nations Committee on the Rights of the Child in its latest observations on Sri Lanka states that a high number of children are subjected to abuse and violence, including corporal punishment at home, alternative care settings, penal institutions and schools due to insufficient legal provisions. Also, by the Supreme Court judgment related to a Fundamental Rights Petition filed by a student recently, who was slapped by a teacher which resulted in a permanent hearing impairment, has determined that the teacher in concern and the State have violated Article 11 of the Constitution. It has also been scientifically proved that such corporal punishment has a long-term effect on a child physically and mentally. Therefore, Legal Amendments to cover any act falling under the category of cruel and/or degrading physical and/or non-physical punishment should be introduced expeditiously. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President and the Minister of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms to amend the Penal Code and the Code of Criminal Procedure Act by incorporating provisions for the prohibition of corporal punishment in all spheres, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment of the Sri Lanka Telecommunications Act, No.25 of 1991
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at its meeting held on 2024-01-01 to amend the Sri Lanka Telecommunications Act No. 25 of 1991. Accordingly, the clearance of the Attorney General have been received for the Sri Lanka Telecommunications (Amendment) Bill, which has been prepared in all three languages by the Legal Draftsman. The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Technology to publish the said Bill in the Government Gazette and thereafter to submit it to Parliament for approval, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Designating CHINA HARBOUR ENGINEERING COMPANY (LANKA)	LIMITED as a Secondary Business of Strategic Importance
decision_details: - CHINA HARBOUR ENGINEERING COMPANY (LANKA) LIMITED has been identified as a Secondary Business of Strategic Importance as a business engaged in business activities of generation of employment opportunities, sustainable development and urban amenity operations in the settlement of a residential community. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Investment Promotion to grant the Exemptions or Incentives proposed in the Acts identified under Schedule II of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission Act, to the respective business and to publish the Order for the same through a Gazette Notification, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Extension of the Project period of the Technological Education Development Programme under the loan from OPEC Fund for International Development
decision_details: - Although the Technological Education Development Programme was initiated in the year 2018 and was scheduled to be completed by the year 2022, owing to the reasons such as Covid pandemic and the economic adversities arisen in the country, the said project could not be completed within the stipulated time period. Previously, approval of the Cabinet has been granted to extend the project period until 2024‑03‑30. Under the project, it has been planned to construct 36 technology laboratories across the 09 provinces, 04 laboratories designated for each province, and to upgrade 15 existing building laboratories. The physical progress of the project as of now is 65%. Further, it has been planned to utilize the foreign funds expected to be remained under the project to establish and upgrade Mini Technology Units for 135 schools where the technology stream is already in operation as well as to supply essential technical goods and equipment and for the capacity building of the teachers. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Education to further extend the project period up to 2025‑03‑30, so that anticipated objectives of the project could be achieved, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Development of Self-sustained Culture-based Inland Fisheries
decision_details: - The Government of Japan has agreed to provide a grant of US$ 3 million for the Project for Development of Self-sustained Culture-based Inland Fisheries to Ensure Food and Nutrition Security and Livelihood Improvements in Rural Communities to be implemented by the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO). The proposed project is planned to be implemented in Anuradhapura, Batticaloa, Mullaitivu and Monaragala Districts and is expected to increase inland fish production in the selected reservoirs and ensure sustainability of the inland fishery industry. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries to exempt the relevant taxes for goods and equipment to be imported for the implementation of the said Project, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Utilization of resources of the Sri Lanka Forestry Institute of the Department of Forest Conservation to popularize forestry education
decision_details: - It has been recognized that, in addition to the regular in-service training courses conducted for officers of the Department of Forest Conservation, conducting training programmes for officers in Government and Non-government institutions as well using the facilities available in the Sri lanka Forestry Institute could develop positive attitudes towards forests among them and their knowledge and skills. Further, providing the facilities of the Sri Lanka Forestry Institute to other Institutions and the public also enables the Government to earn an additional income. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Wildlife and Forest Resources Conservation to provide the Sri Lanka Forestry Institute, Nuwara Eliya and its Inamaluwa Field Training Centre to external parties for conducting short term training programmes, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between Rwanda and Sri Lanka for exemption of Diplomatic, Official or Service Passport Holders from obtaining Visa
decision_details: - Even though approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2019‑05‑07 to sign a Memorandum of Understanding for exemption of Diplomatic, Official or Service Passport holders from the requirement of obtaining Visa with the objective of developing bilateral relations between Sri Lanka and Rwanda, the said MoU could not be signed as of now. The proposal made by the Minister of Public Security to sign the said MoU between Sri Lanka and Rwanda for exemption of Diplomatic, Official or Service Passport holders from obtaining Visa for a period not exceeding 30 days, as agreed between two parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Rehabilitation of the Karainagar Boat Yard of Cey-Nor Foundation Limited
decision_details: - Cey-Nor Foundation Limited established in the year 1967 in Karainagar, Jaffna with aid of NORGES GODTEMPLAR UNGDOMS FORBUND (NGU), a Norwegian Non Governmental Organization, has been incorporated as a Public Company in the year 1990. This Foundation has been engaged in the fiberglass boat manufacturing and operations of the Karainagar Boat Yard has been ceased since 1990 due to the situation which prevailed in that area. Although, Rs. 350 million had been spent for the renovation of this Boat Yard in the year 2016, balance civil works and procurement of machinery have not been completed due to insufficient funds. The Government of India has agreed to provide a grant subject to a maximum of Sri Lankan Rupees 290 million to complete the rehabilitation works of the Karainagar Boat Yard belonging to Cey-Nor Foundation Limited and for several other works. Concurrence of the Department of National Planing and the Department of External Resources has been received for this Project. Clarence of the Attorney General and the concurrence of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs have been received for the Memorandum of Understanding to be signed between the two parties to obtain the proposed grant. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Fisheries to sign the MoU to obtain the said grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Operation of a Gold Shop at Departure/Transit Area of the Bandaranaike 	International Airport (BIA), Katunayaka
decision_details: - The appropriateness of introducing a gold business at the Departure/Transit Area of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayaka as a new business venture has been considered and proposals in that regard have been submitted by Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited. Since this facility is not available at the Bandaranaike International Airport at present, Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited has planned to establish a "Gold Shop" at the Departure/ Transit area at BIA. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to invite bids following the International Competitive Bidding Procedure to select a suitable operator to operate a Gold Shop at the Departure/ Transit area at BIA, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Bilateral Air Services Agreement between Sri Lanka and Kazakhstan
decision_details: - 	Although approval had been granted at the Cabinet meeting held on 2015‑05‑13 	to sign an Air Services Agreement between the aeronautical authorities of the Kazakhstan and Sri Lanka for the purpose of developing Air Services between the two countries, the said Air Services Agreement has not yet been signed. Under the proposed Air Services Agreement, it is expected to operate 07 frequencies per week 	from any point in Sri Lanka to Astana and/ or Almaty in Kazakhstan. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation to sign the Air Services Agreement which has been agreed upon by both parties, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Kankesanthurai Harbour Rehabilitation Project
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2017‑05‑02 to implement the Kankesanthurai Harbour Rehabilitation Project under the Indian Credit Line and approval has been granted on 2019‑12‑18 to award project management consultancy services. Owing to exceeding the estimated cost prepared by the consultancy services agency than the relevant loan amount, it has been impossible to proceed with the project activities as expected. Therefore, further discussions have been held with the Government of India regarding the possibility of completing the said project under the Public-Private Partnership Methodology. Accordingly, considering the importance of the said project, the Government of India has agreed to provide its total estimated cost as a Financial Grant. Accordingly, The proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to accept the said Financial Grant and enter into the relevant agreements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Transforming the Mirissa Marine Zone into a Blue Flag Coastal Zone that meets international standards and a Marine Wildlife Sanctuary
decision_details: - The proposal to declare the Mirissa Marine Zone as a Marine Wildlife Sanctuary has been taken into discussion at the Cabinet meeting held on 2023‑05‑22. A Cabinet Sub-Committee has been appointed then under the Chairmanship of the Hon. Prime Minister to further study on the said proposal with the participation of all relevant parties and submit recommendations to the Cabinet. Accordingly, the said Sub-Committee has submitted its recommendations aiming at increasing the tourism economy in the Southern province by five times by transforming the Mirissa Marine Zone into a Blue Flag Zone that meets international standards and a Marine wildlife Sanctuary. The proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister to implement the said recommendations through the relevant ministries and institutions in charge of the subject, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Indonesia - Sri Lanka Preferential Trade Agreement (ISLPTA)
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted at the meeting held on 2023‑07‑10 to initiate negotiations on a Preferential Trade Agreement with Indonesia. Official discussions related thereto have been conducted on 2024‑03‑14 between the State Minister of Foreign Affairs and the Deputy Minister of Trade in Indonesia and the First Meeting of the Trade Negotiation Committee has been held on 3rd and 4th April 2024, via online. At the said Negotiation Committee,views have been exchanged between the two parties regarding the modality of the negotiations, time frame for the exchange of relevant data, scope and coverage. The two parties have agreed to hold the 2nd meeting of the said Committee on 19th and 20th of June 2024 in Colombo. Accordingly, the Cabinet considered the facts submitted by the Hon. President on the progress so far achieved from the proposed Preferential Trade Agreement as referred to at above.

title: Vesting the Land where the Negombo Eththukala Beach Park is located with the Urban Development Authority for the development of the said Park
decision_details: - The Eththukala Beach Park (Browns Beach) with an extent of 06 Acres 01 Rood 9.1 Perches is the only beach park in the Negombo Municipal Council area and it is located in the High-Density Promotional Tourism Zone of the Negombo Development Plan 2021‑2030. The Negombo Municipal Council has decided to vest the management of the said Park with the Urban Development Authority with a view to converting the same as an attractive park for the local and foreign travelers. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development and Housing to vest the said land with the  Urban Development Authority as a Free Grant as per the provisions of the State Land Ordinance in order to develop the same as a tourist zone in conformity with the relevant development plans, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Expansion of the Mindfulness Training Programme being implemented 	for school children islandwide
decision_details: - Approval of the Cabinet has been granted on 2022‑12‑12 to implement the "Programme for the Introduction of Mindfulness for School Children" with a  view to creating calmness by avoiding the frequent complexity and stress developing in the minds of school children. Accordingly, this programme is being implemented  successfully in each school in the country over a period of one year. The proposal made by the Minister of Education to commemorate the day following the Vesak Day as the National Mindfulness Day annually, to implement the programme called "Towards a Mindfulness Country from the Vesak Week' annually in future coinciding with the Vesak Week and to hold the 'International Mindfulness Conference' at the beginning of the Month of May in each year from the year 2024, as a step forward of the said Programme, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Entering into Memoranda of Understanding/Agreements in view of Educational Collaboration
decision_details:
- The proposal made by the Minister of Education to enter into the following  Memoranda of Understanding/Agreements between Sri Lankan Universities and Foreign Universities/Agencies with the objective of developing the higher educational collaboration, was approved by the Cabinet. 

*	The Memorandum of Understanding between the Sabaragamuwa University of Sri Lanka and the University of Salford, United Kingdom pertaining to fostering multidisciplinary research for disaster resilience and integrated natural resource management.

*	The Tripartite Agreement among the University of Jaffna and the National University of Singapore and Singapore Health Services Pte. Ltd. to establish a Regional Collaborating Centre with the aim of coordinating global health efforts.

*	The Memorandum of Understanding between the University of Ruhuna and the Southern Health NHS Trust of the United Kingdom and Northern Ireland pertaining to the MARIE Project on the mental health effects of menopause on women globally.

*	The Memorandum of Understanding between the Open University of Sri Lanka and the Tomorrow Technology Education Service Center, China pertaining to the designation and empowerment of Tomorrow Technology Education Service Center as the duly authorized representative for the purpose of endorsing and marketing the academic programmes offered by the Open University of Sri Lanka to the students from China.

*	The Memorandum of Understanding between the University of Sri Jayewardenepura and the Tomas Bata University in the Czech Republic to develop cooperation between the two parties.

*	The Agreement between the Rajarata University of Sri Lanka and the University of Naples Federico II, Italy on capacity building, research collaborations, innovations and use of aquaculture biosystems technology.

title: Establishment of the Institute of Economics and Trade, Sri Lanka
decision_details: - It is highly important for the Members of Parliament and Senior Public Officials to have a training on Economics and Trade affairs enabling them to reach informed decisions formulating and implementing National Policies. In order to facilitate for the purpose, it has been found appropriate to establish an Institute by the name of "Sri Lanka Institute of Economics and Trade" by an Act of Parliament. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft a Bill to establish the Sri Lanka Institute of Economics and Trade, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Signing of the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons  (TPNW)
decision_details: - The Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons was adopted at the United Nations Organization on 07th July 2017 as the first globally applicable multilateral agreement to prohibiting nuclear weapons, with the support of 122 states. The said Treaty has been effective since 22nd January 2021 and has 86 signatories and 57 ratifications. Sri Lanka supported the adoption of this Treaty by voting in favour at the United Nations Conference and constantly promotes the universal adherence to the same. The said Treaty prohibits the participating states from developing, testing, producing, manufacturing, transferring, possessing, stockpiling nuclear weapons or other nuclear explosive devices and threatening to use them  or allowing to station such nuclear weapons in their territory and assisting, encouraging or inducing anyone to engage in any of such activities as well. Signing this Treaty is entirely consistent with Sri Lanka's principled stance against Weapons of Mass Destruction and in favour of nuclear disarmament. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Foreign Minister to sign the said Treaty by Sri Lanka and initiate the process of reviewing national legislation with a view to completing its ratification processes as soon as possible, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Support to Justice Sector in Sri Lanka Project
decision_details: - The European Union has extended its willingness to provide a grant of Euro 18 million to implement a project by the name of “Support to Justice Sector in Sri Lanka Project”, with a view to setting up an improved and responsive justice system in Sri Lanka by improving the accessibility and quality of service delivery. The said project will be implemented by the Ministry of Justice and the total estimated cost is Euro 19.27 million. Balance provisions for the project will be financed by the United Nations Childeren's Fund (UNICEF) and the United Nations Development Programme in addition to the provisions granted by the European Union. As such, the proposal made by the Hon. Prime Minister in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, to enter into a Grant Agreement with the European Union to obtain that grant, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of Parallel Roads for access to the houses situated on either side of the Matara - Beliatte Railway Track
decision_details: - The construction activities of the Matara - Beliatte railway project is nearing completion and it is expected to commence train operations from the year 2019 covering the entire coastal railway track from Colombo to Beliatte. The need for the construction of parallel roads has been identified considering the necessity of providing access to the houses of the people living in the area  being situated on either side of the Matara - Beliatte railway track. Accordingly, the proposal made by Hon. Nimal Siripala de Silva, the Minister of Transport and Civil Aviation, to get the construction activities of 54 roads with a total length of 12.95 km done under the supervision of the Road Development Authority, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Amendment to the Firing Ranges and Military Training Act, No.24 of 1951
decision_details:
- The firing ranges established in the country are presently provided by the Ministry of Defence for training only to the Tri-Forces and the Sri Lanka Police. It has become a timely requirement to utilize these firing ranges for providing the training on firearms and explosives more formally to the persons recruited as security officers to the private security agencies, state banks, public institutions and the semi-government institutions and the sea marshals deployed for the protection of merchant vessels.

	Accordingly, the proposal made by H.E. the President Maithripala Sirisena in his capacity as the Minister of Defence, to amend the Firing Ranges and Military Training Act, No.24 of 1951, to make enable to utilize the said firing ranges for the purpose intended, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Moratuwa, Lunawa Urban Housing Project
decision_details: - the contract for the construction of above low income housing scheme consisting of 356 housing units at Lunawa situated in the coastal belt of Moratuwa has been awarded to the State Engineering Corporation.   The proposal made  by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities,  to increase the cost estimate of the project due to additional items of work included, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Moratuwa, Angulana Multi-storey Housing Scheme - First Phase and Second Phase
decision_details: - construction work of 135 housing units under the First Phase  and 153 housing units under the Second Phase of the above Multi-storied Housing Project has been completed by the Urban Settlement Development Authority to resettle the families displaced due to sea erosion and low income urban community residing within the limits of the Moratuwa Municipal Council Area.  Construction work of the First and Second Phases of the Project has been awarded to the State Engineering Corporation.  The proposals made by Hon. Wimal Weerawansa, Minister of Construction, Engineering Services, Housing and Common Amenities,  to increase the two cost estimates of the two projects due to additional items of work included, were approved by the Cabinet.

title: Threat of Highly Pathogenic Avian Influenza
decision_details: - Hon. Arumugan Thondaman, Minister of Livestock and Rural Community Development, brought to the notice of the Cabinet the prevalence of Avian Influenza (Bird Flu) in the villages of Chennithala, Aalapuzha and Kerala in South India, as reported to him.  The proposal made by the Minister to take preventive measures for its entry into Sri Lanka, specially with the importation of poultry products during this festive season, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Programme to strengthen Small and Medium Scale Millers and Stockists
Increase of the Monthly Allowance paid to Trainees of Traditional Handicrafts Sector under the National Crafts Council
decision_details: - the National Crafts Council has undertaken many craft training programmes to strengthen the skills and capacity of the craftsmen and provides training in the 20 craft clusters of handicrafts industry at rural level through the Master Craftsman Training Programme since 1985 and in addition, through the Handicraft Training Centres since 2009.  Handicrafts which is a traditional national heritage, provides a formidable platform to showcase the culture of our country to the world.  The proposal made by Hon. Douglas Devananda, Minister of Traditional Industries and Small Enterprise Development, to increase the monthly allowance of Rs.500/- paid to trainees undergoing training in the handicrafts field under the National Crafts Council, to Rs.1,000/- was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of the proposed Sri Lanka State Audit Service as a Special Service independent of other Services
decision_details: - the functions of the Auditor General are specified in terms of Article 154 of the Constitution wherein he is required to carry out annual audit of financial statements relating to the Ministries, Departments, State Corporations, Provincial Councils, Local Authorities and Foreign funded Projects and report the position to Parliament.  The Sri Lanka Audit Service and Audit Examiners' Service assist the Auditor General in the performance and discharge of the statutory duties and functions entrusted to him.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, to proceed with the activities relating to the establishment of the proposed Sri Lanka State Audit Service as a special service, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of SAARC Cultural Centre in Navimana, Matara
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. T.B. Ekanayake, Minister of Culture and the Arts, to proceed with the activities relating to the above construction work, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of the Head Office Building for the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka intends to construct a new building in a block of land in close proximity to the Bandaranaike International Airport for its Head Office. The proposal made by Hon. Piyankara Jayaratne, Minister of Civil Aviation, to award the above tender as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Clean Energy & Network Efficiency Improvement Project - Package 1 - Lot B : Mannar Transmission Infrastructure - Lot - B : Construction of New Anuradhapura to Vavuniya 55 km, Double Circuit, 2xZebra, 132kV Transmission Line and Vavuniya to Mannar 70 km, Double Circuit, Single Zebra, 132 kV Transmission Line (Designed for 220kV operation)
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to award the contract for package 1 as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Augmentation of 132/33kV Grid Substation at Kiribathkumbura
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to award the above contract as recommended by the Standing Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (SCAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Kandy City Waste Water Management Project - Award of Contract for Design & Construction of Waste Water Treatment Plant, Main Pump House, Treated Effluent Disposal System and Supply of Operation & Maintenance Equipment
decision_details: - the objective of this project is to prevent pollution of the Kandy City water sources, Mahaweli River and the Kandy Lake by collecting and treating domestic and industrial waste water with treatment facility.  This project is to be implemented under four contract packages and this is contract package (1).   The proposal made by Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena, Minister of Water Supply and Drainage, to award the above contract as recommended by the Cabinet Appointed Procurement Committee (CAPC), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a Flyover Across the Railway Crossing at Maho Junction
decision_details: - Nikaweratiya - Moragollagama - Siyambalangamuwa Road (B 326) crosses the Main Railway Line leading to Northern, North Central and Eastern Provinces at Maho town. Long delays to the movement of traffic on the above road are experienced due to frequent gate closures and congestion in the Maho town area. The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Highways, Ports and Shipping, to award the contract for the purpose as recommended by the Procurement Appeal Board (PAB), was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Construction of a New Building for the Attorney General’s Department
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, to have the construction of the new building of the Attorney General's Department carried out in two stages, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Tea Promotion Unit in the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing, China
decision_details: - the domestic consumption of black tea is increasing in China and the current import of black tea is around 15 million kg and it is estimated that it will reach 100 million kg by the year 2020.  Sri Lanka is the largest supplier of black tea to China and shares 27% of the market.  The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, Minister of Plantation Industries, to set up a Tea Promotion Unit at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Beijing, China and to proceed with the related activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Holding the event of ‘CEYLON TEA EXPO 2015’ in Sri Lanka
decision_details: - the Ministry of Plantation Industries in association with the Sri Lanka Tea Board is planning to organize the first ever 'Ceylon Tea Expo 2015' exhibition and a conference from 6th to 8th November 2015 at the BMICH, Colombo. This event envisages to attract international buyers, Super Market Chains, Wholesalers, Value Chain Developers, Institutions, Associations, etc. This event will also generate revenue to the country while giving adequate publicity for Ceylon Tea  throughout the World. The proposal made by Hon. Mahinda Samarasinghe, Minister of Plantation Industries, to proceed with the related activities, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Increase of the Monthly Allowance for Food and Service Facilities of  Student Teachers in  National Colleges of Education
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Bandula Gunawardena, Minister of Education to increase the monthly allowance paid to a scholar during the academic training period by Rs.1,000/- making it Rs.3,500/- per month and during the in-service training period by Rs.1,000/-, making it Rs.4,000/- per month, in keeping with the Budget proposals for the year 2015, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: SAARC Framework Agreement for Energy Cooperation (Electricity)
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. (Mrs.) Pavithra Wanniarachchi, Minister of Power and Energy, to ratify the above Agreement which has already been signed at the 18th SAARC Summit held in Kathmandu, Nepal, with the minor amendments proposed by the Government of Pakistan, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Establishment of a Dairy Processing Plant at Badalgama
decision_details: - Milco Private Limited (Milco) which is a public enterprise engaged in milk processing industry has four main processing factories at Narahenpita, Digana, Ambewela and Polonnaruwa.  Milco factory at Narahenpita which is located in a highly urbanized area has been proposed to be relocated at Badalgama in the Gampaha District. It is proposed to establish a dairy processing plant together with all necessary infrastructure and amenities, to produce pasteurized milk, yoghurt, ice cream, butter, cheese etc. in the new factory at Badalgama.  The proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Finance and Planning, to proceed with the activities relating to funding arrangements, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Granting of Dual Citizenship
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to adopt the proposed new Administrative Procedure for granting of dual citizenship, was approved by the Cabinet.

title: Post Office Security Fund
decision_details: - the proposal made by Hon. Jeewan Kumaranathunga, Minister of Postal Services, to instruct the Legal Draftsman to draft amending legislation to amend the Post Office Security Fund Ordinance to meet the present day needs, was  approved by the Cabinet.

title: Allocation of Land at Hulftsdorp to the Attorney General's Department
decision_details: - the proposal made by H.E. the President, in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and Urban Development, to allocate a vacant plot of land around 80 perches in extent situated at Hulftsdorp, Colombo 12, owned by the Urban Development Authority, to the Attorney General's Department, as the existing space in the buildings is inadequate to meet the present requirements of the Department, was approved by the Cabinet.
